name: Alfaisal University
title: Information Technology (IT) Technician
description: overview departmentinformation technology divisioninformation technology job familyinformation technology support reports toinformation technology specialist locationalfaisal university - riyadh job summary the it technician is responsible for assisting the alfaisal university employees with technical support of smart classrooms, auditoriums, desktop computers, and related technologies. support includes specification, installation, and testing of computer systems and peripherals within established standards and guidelines. primary duties & responsibilities sets up and installs equipment such as microphones, sound speakers, video screens, projectors, video monitors, recording equipment, connecting wires, and cables, for classrooms and auditoriums. works with both users and vendors to provide higher-level support in response to user problems and questions regarding application/system functionality, input/output, reporting, and operational procedures. assists users and customers in the use of media presentation and audio-visual system functionality. operates it and audio-visual equipment, which involves regular checking of the devices, replacement of the lamp, cleaning of filters, etc monitors the system to ensure the quality by checking the sound quality and projectors precision for classrooms and auditoriums. diagnoses and corrects it and av system issues by regularly checking the podium pc and smartboard to ensure efficiency and effectiveness. troubleshoots and resolves the auditorium and classrooms audio-visual systems’ problems during the events and lectures and monitors the equipment while in use. performs routine testing and problem diagnosis for projectors, microphones, speakers, amplifiers, lcd/plasma displays, sound system and keyboards. operates media equipment including audio and video playback, monitors, lighting controls, and computer equipment during the program. assists communication & network technician in creating materials for end-user frequently asked questions (faqs). develops and maintains an inventory of all monitors, keyboards, hard drives, modems, network cards, and other components and equipment. determines the source and nature of equipment malfunction using diagnostic and application software to adjust, repair, and replace malfunctioning equipment. controls and keeps track of application license registrations to ensure that they do not expire. liaises with third party engineers to carry out hardware servicing, repairs, and installations. prioritizes issues and escalating complex problems to it specialist. performs all duties in a professional, components, and confidential manner. performs all other related duties as required or assigned by the manager. education bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, or equivalent from an accredited institute. professional experience minimum of one (1) year experience in installing and updating operating systems, data collection, or related fields (desirable). please upload cv in english only

name: Ma’aden
title: Lead Planner, Project Scheduler & Estimator I
description: key accountabilities: develop project plans, work breakdown structures (wbs), and project schedules using project management software, such as primavera p6, microsoft project, or similar tools, to define project scope, activities, and timelines. coordinate with project managers, engineers, and stakeholders to gather project requirements, objectives, and constraints, and develop project execution strategies to achieve project goals. create detailed project schedules, including activity sequences, durations, dependencies, and resource assignments, and update schedules as needed to reflect changes in project scope or priorities. conduct resource planning and allocation, including labor, equipment, and materials, to ensure adequate resources are available to support project activities and meet project deadlines. estimate project costs, including labor, materials, equipment, and subcontractor services, using cost estimation techniques, historical data, and vendor quotes, to develop accurate project budgets. analyze project risks and uncertainties, and develop risk mitigation strategies and contingency plans to minimize project delays, cost overruns, and other project risks. monitor project progress against schedule, budget, and performance metrics, and provide regular updates to project stakeholders, identifying deviations and recommending corrective actions as needed. coordinate with project teams to track project milestones, deliverables, and dependencies, and resolve scheduling conflicts or resource constraints to ensure project milestones are achieved on time and within budget. conduct project performance analysis, including earned value analysis (eva), schedule variance analysis, and cost performance analysis, to assess project performance and identify areas for improvement. provide leadership, guidance, and mentorship to junior planners, schedulers, and estimators, and support their professional development and growth within the organization. minimum qualifications, experience and competencies: minimum qualifications: bachelor's degree in engineering, construction management, project management, or related field; master's degree or professional certification in project management is advantageous. minimum experience: minimum of 5-7 years of experience in project planning, scheduling, and estimating roles, with progressive experience in project management and leadership positions. experience with project management methodologies, such as agile, waterfall, or critical path method (cpm), and familiarity with industry standards and best practices in project management. skills: strong technical knowledge and proficiency in project management software, such as primavera p6, microsoft project, or similar tools, for developing project plans, schedules, and budgets. excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex project data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions to optimize project performance

name: Dar Al Riyadh
title: Project Director
description: responsibilities: develop and implement a comprehensive project management plan that aligns with the client’s goals, quality standards, and budgetary constraints. oversee all phases of the project lifecycle, including planning, design, construction, and commissioning, to ensure seamless execution. establish and enforce project schedules, quality standards, and safety requirements. lead and manage the pmc team, which includes project managers, engineers, schedulers, cost controllers, and quality assurance personnel. facilitate collaboration and effective communication among the pmc team, contractors, designers, and the client to drive project progress and resolve issues. serve as the primary point of contact between the client, pmc team, contractors, and other stakeholders. conduct regular project status meetings and provide comprehensive updates on project progress, financials, schedule, and any potential risks. anticipate client needs, address concerns, and ensure alignment with the client’s strategic vision. proactively identify, assess, and manage risks that could impact project delivery. develop contingency plans to mitigate potential issues, ensuring minimal disruption to the project schedule and budget. resolve any project challenges, contractual issues, or conflicts that arise. oversee quality control measures, ensuring adherence to industry standards, client requirements, and local regulatory standards. supervise third-party inspections, audits, and documentation to guarantee regulatory compliance and achieve the highest levels of quality. monitor the project’s financial performance, including budgeting, forecasting, and cost control. implement financial controls to prevent budget overruns, identify cost-saving opportunities, and ensure accurate financial reporting to the client. develop and enforce governance frameworks to ensure consistent, structured project management practices across all project phases. implement performance tracking systems, including key performance indicators (kpis) and milestones, to monitor progress and ensure alignment with project objectives. coordinate with design consultants to ensure project designs align with client requirements, regulatory standards, and sustainability goals. review and approve design changes, and ensure efficient integration of design and construction activities to avoid rework and delays. lead the change control process, managing scope changes and assessing their impact on schedule, cost, and resources. ensure all change requests are documented, evaluated, and approved by stakeholders before implementation, maintaining transparency and accountability. promote sustainability initiatives within the project, ensuring compliance with environmental regulations and implementing practices that minimize environmental impact. facilitate environmental audits and sustainability reviews to integrate eco-friendly practices throughout the project lifecycle. oversee contract administration, ensuring that contractor obligations are met and all deliverables adhere to quality, budget, and timeline requirements. manage claims, variations, and contractual disputes efficiently, working with legal and procurement teams to protect the client’s interests. liaise with local, state, and national regulatory bodies to obtain required permits and approvals. ensure that the project complies with aviation industry standards, health and safety regulations, and other relevant legal requirements. champion a strong health and safety culture, enforcing strict safety protocols to protect all personnel and minimize accidents. conduct regular hse audits, safety drills, and risk assessments to maintain a zero-incident workplace. implement digital project management and building information modeling (bim) tools to streamline project controls and improve efficiency. leverage data analytics for forecasting, risk assessment, and decision-making to proactively address challenges. oversee the commissioning and testing phases, ensuring all systems meet performance standards before final handover. develop and execute a comprehensive handover plan, ensuring smooth project transition to operations and maintenance teams with proper documentation and training. conduct post-project evaluations to capture lessons learned and implement best practices in future pmc projects. establish a knowledge-sharing framework within the pmc team to enhance performance and promote continuous improvement. develop contingency plans to address potential crises, such as labor strikes, supply chain disruptions, or natural disasters. act as the crisis management lead, coordinating emergency response efforts and ensuring timely communication with all stakeholders. engage with local communities to address concerns and promote the social benefits of the airport project.lead initiatives that support corporate social responsibility, ensuring that the project positively impacts the local economy and society. essential requirements: bachelor’s degree in civil engineering, project management, or a related field (master’s degree preferred). professional certifications such as pmp, pgmp, or prince2. minimum of 25 years of experience in project management, with at least 10 years in a pmc role on airport or large-scale infrastructure projects. proven track record of managing large, complex projects, including project scope, budget, and schedule. advanced knowledge of pmc processes, construction laws, and regulatory requirements in the aviation sector. exceptional leadership, negotiation, and interpersonal skills to engage diverse stakeholders effectively. proficiency in project management and scheduling software, cost control tools, and risk management methodologies. strategic thinker with problem-solving abilities and meticulous attention to detail.

name: Devoteam
title: Lead Cloud Architect
description: we are entrepreneurs in disruptive technology, at devoteam, we deliver innovative technology consulting for business. digital transformakers, we are 7,000+ professionals across emea dedicated to ensuring our clients win their digital battle. we improve business performance making their companies truly digital. we advise our clients and build it infrastructure for digital, making sure people are along for the ride. devoteam middle east, we are the region's leading consulting firm delivering innovative business & technology consulting & solutions. our 14 years of existence anchored in technologies that enables our clients business to flourish, accordingly our focus is to help our clients' win the digital battle, adapted to our clients’ business challenges, with a unique consideration to its impact on their systems and structures. to know more about us, please visit: www.devoteam.com our mission is to build cultures of innovation at companies by transforming the way they work, by modernising their it infrastructure & apps, and by elevating their customer experiences. as a premier google cloud partner, we do this by implementing innovative google cloud solutions and by leveraging cutting-edge ai & machine learning technologies. devoteam g cloud’s certified cloud engineers build disruptive solutions on google cloud platform to give organisations a competitive advantage. we migrate and modernise legacy applications & it infrastructure using cloud native solutions such as kubernetes, anthos and serverless solutions. we help our customers with their hybrid- and multi-cloud strategies and to get to actionable business insights faster, by accelerating their data & analytics. together we create scalable, future-proof & secure data journeys. and we build ai & ml solutions on top of this data to help customers to create better customer experiences. next to that, we give the workplace of the future shape with solutions like google workspace. responsibilities: this position is a stakeholder-facing role and embodies the responsibility of capturing prioritization, and delivery of project expectations for all aspects of the projects you work on. you can lead technical customer workshops and design a solution meeting the customer requirements on all aspects of the project (governance, security, networking, billing, operations). you are an advocate for cloud adoption and enlighten customers in their cloud adoption strategy, no matter their cloud maturity. excellent communication and interpersonal skills: you have the ability to communicate tasks, challenges, and results clearly to technical & non-technical colleagues and customers. ability to understand both the business and technical requirements and apply existing, or develop new methodologies to satisfy those requirements you understand both business and technical priorities and have a realistic view of timelines and deliverables. you are able to guide and streamline technical tracks of a multidisciplinary team, composed of colleagues and customers. you advocate the use of cloud best practices in all aspects of your job and the deliverables of your team. you mentor and guide junior colleagues through their journey in the team and within the projects you collaborate on. expertise in operations in cloud and hybrid environments. expertise in security in cloud and hybrid environments. expertise in networking in cloud and hybrid environments (especially firewalling, routing & dns) expertise of devops & cloud automation using infrastructure as code (especially terraform) knowledge of containerized solutions (especially kubernetes) knowledge of micro services architecture knowledge of shell/bash scripting experience in it consulting knowledge of operational tooling for logging, monitoring & backup knowledge of vmware knowledge of database technologies like postgresql, mysql and sql server knowledge of specific tools like terraform cloud, gitlab ci, cloud build.. knowledge of ldap & active directory knowledge of interoperability technology (e.g. message oriented middleware, event hubs or similar) knowledge of cryptography (tls, ca, pki) an exciting job where innovation in technology is not a buzzword but a reality continuous training & development of soft- and hard skills, including training at several google locations a competitive salary, inline with your profile a flexible package of extra-legal advantages that could include a company car, a fuel card, meal vouchers, a laptop, and health insurance, … an awesome team of colleagues & regular team-building activities a "googley" well-equipped office close to brussels the ability to work with the world’s leading companies in technology and innovation.

name: John Crane
title: Senior Maintenance Engineer
description: john crane asset management solutions (jcams) is the john crane centre of excellence for maintenance consultancy and condition monitoring. this provides the opportunity for an individual, with the appropriate skills and interest, to play a key role in the development and delivery of this business stream. as part of a dynamic team, the senior maintenance engineer will be familiar with and responsible for the delivery of maintenance management systems and solutions. the candidate will be a team player and accustomed to working to deadlines and budgets. they will have experience in the energy sector and be conversant with quality management systems and their controls. ideally the candidate will have a practical knowledge of cmms, aims, erp or eam solutions from a management, user or implementation perspective. duties & responsibilities responsibilities: develop project plans with accurate resourcing and work schedules. develop method of work statements and processes for all projects undertaken. develop maintenance philosophies. develop asset registers, hierarchies and classifications from p&ids, pfds, single line drawings and other data sources. prepare for and conduct preliminary criticality analysis studies. prepare for and conduct maintenance strategy analysis (failure modes and effects analysis, rcm, criticality, etc.) using proprietary software. develop maintenance strategies. development of planned maintenance routines for core discipline. construction of planned maintenance program. assist with workload smoothing and man-power projections. perform spares analysis for critical equipment. perform project manager role as required and as agreed with the resource manager. work within the requirements of the integrated management system. ensure the strict adherence to quality, health and safety and environmental management systems across the business. the individual skills and experience: recognised engineering qualification or extensive practical maintenance experience. an in depth understanding of maintenance management practices and systems. ability to develop asset registers, maintenance strategies and planned maintenance routine for core disciplines. demonstrated experience in a similar role. actively involved in the management, use or implementation of maintenance management systems. extensive practical involvement in the maintenance of onshore or offshore assets within the energy sector. report writing and effective communication. diversity & inclusion: we believe that different perspectives and backgrounds are what make a company flourish. all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, economic status, disability, age, or any other legally protected characteristics. we are proud to be an inclusive company with values grounded in equality and ethics, where we celebrate, support, and embrace diversity. at no time during the hiring process will john crane, smiths group nor any of our recruitment partners ever request payment to enable participation – including, but not limited to, interviews or testing. avoid fraudulent requests by applying jobs directly through our career’s website (careers – john crane)

title: Area Sales Manager Engineer (Architecture)Riyadh
description: key responsibilities: 1. sales strategy development: - develop and implement sales strategies to achieve revenue targets within the assigned area. - identify market trends and customer needs to inform product offerings. 2. client relationship management: - build and maintain strong relationships with architects, contractors, and other stakeholders. - conduct regular meetings and presentations to showcase products and services. 3. technical support: - provide technical guidance and support to clients regarding architectural products. - collaborate with engineering teams to address client specifications and requirements. 4. market analysis: - analyze market dynamics, competitive landscape, and customer feedback to identify opportunities for growth. - prepare reports on sales performance, market trends, and customer insights. 5. product knowledge: - stay informed about industry trends, new technologies, and product developments. - train and educate clients on product benefits and applications. 6. sales forecasting: - prepare sales forecasts and budgets based on market analysis and historical data. - monitor performance against targets and adjust strategies as needed. 7. collaboration: - work closely with marketing and product development teams to align sales efforts with company objectives. - participate in trade shows, industry events, and networking opportunities to promote products. 8. negotiation and closing: - negotiate contracts and pricing with clients. - close sales and ensure a smooth transition to project execution. qualifications: - education: bachelor’s degree in architecture, engineering, business, or a related field. - experience: proven experience in sales, preferably in the architecture or construction industry. -skills: strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills; technical proficiency in architectural products and solutions; ability to analyze market data. - certifications: relevant sales or industry certifications may be a plus. work environment: - primarily field-based with frequent travel to client sites. - office work for reporting and strategic planning. this role is crucial for driving sales growth, understanding client needs, and ensuring the successful promotion of architectural products and services in the marketplace. job type: full-time education: bachelor's (preferred)

name: Parsons

name: Parsons
title: Smart City Manager
description: job description: parsons is looking for an amazingly talented smart city manager to join our team! in this role you are responsible for the support of other involved managers on the project to meet project goals and objectives. plan, organize, and supervise the work of the smart city team members to ensure all work in performed within the parameters of the project schedule. what you'll be doing: review and analyze all existing documented smart city initiatives, projects, and ideas. identify smart city opportunities and strategies that relate to both community and industrial land use types. this includes requirements to facilitate the adoption of industry 4.0. develop and implement a comprehensive smart city framework and related strategies with a strong emphasis on sustainability; integrating innovative solutions for city development, including but not limited to transportation, energy efficiency, waste management, and overall urban resilience. collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and execute urban planning projects that align with the principles of smart city development and sustainability. lead the evaluation and selection of smart technologies, ensuring seamless integration and compatibility within existing and planned urban infrastructure. identify revenue-generating smart city initiatives, and create innovative and intelligent ways of making jcpdi more resource-efficient, citizen-friendly, and sustainable. collaborate and coordinate with environmental and sustainability departments and ensure that the smart city roadmap reflects the client's sustainability objectives oversee the development of policies and standards that promote sustainable practices and the responsible use of technology in urban planning, to ensure implementation of the royal commission vision 2030. plan, organize, and supervise the work as it relates to the implementation of the smart city strategy. ensure all work is performed within the parameters of the project schedule. works with the key project individuals to devise and execute action plans to rectify potential conflicts, coordination issues, and delays, or to accommodate significant changes to the scope of work. makes recommendations to create project teams capable of completing effective, quality work. if required and as necessary, participate in negotiation with regulatory agencies and public meetings in support of the client. works with other managers, project engineers, and discipline leads to develop budgets, schedules, and plans for the various elements of a project. ensures that the project meets or exceeds the goals established in these plans. promotes technical and commercial excellence on the project through the application of quality assurance processes. monitors and reports to management on the progress of all project activities within the program, including significant milestones, and any conditions, which would affect project cost or schedule. perform other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate. what required skills you'll bring: bachelor's degree in engineering or related field with at least 15 years of experience in a comparable position. a recognized qualification in smart cities planning, or completion of a structured smart cities learning program. work experience across smart city and destinations project lifecycle, from the analysis, identification, and design of smart services to the planning, and driving of implementation. experienced in developing and implementing a comprehensive digital master plan and strategy for urban development and infrastructure. experience in creating a digital twin of a city, or part of a city transformation, would be an advantage. expertise in relevant technologies (such as 4g/5g communications, iot, big data/analytics) proven ability to perform in a management capacity. experience in the mena region and prior knowledge of the kingdom of saudi arabia market is preferable. excellent english written and oral communication skills. some arabic-speaking capability would be a distinct advantage. in-depth and strong knowledge of industry practices and regulations are required. the candidate must be knowledgeable of the current technology that can be effectively utilized in the development of a greenfield development project. minimum clearance required to start: not applicable/none parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. minority/female/disabled/protected veteran.

name: Projects Pioneers Contracting Company
title: Electrical Engineer (OHPL Experience)
description: job title: electrical engineer - overhead power line (ohpl) experience job description: position overview: the electrical engineer - ohpl specialist will be responsible for the design, maintenance, and improvement of overhead power line systems, ensuring they meet industry standards and regulatory requirements. this role involves both field and office work, requiring an understanding of electrical engineering principles, safety standards, and project management. key responsibilities: design and planning develop and review designs for overhead power line systems, ensuring compliance with safety codes and electrical standards. conduct site surveys and analyze geographical data to design effective and efficient ohpl layouts. calculate electrical load, voltage, and line sag, and ensure that designs meet specified load-bearing requirements. use engineering software to model, analyze, and simulate overhead line designs. installation and maintenance supervise the installation and maintenance of overhead lines, including transformers, circuit breakers, insulators, and other key components. conduct routine inspections and perform preventative maintenance on ohpl systems to ensure reliable power delivery. diagnose and troubleshoot issues related to ohpl structures, addressing concerns such as conductor wear, pole deterioration, and environmental impact. safety and compliance ensure compliance with national and international safety standards, such as nesc (national electrical safety code) and osha regulations. develop and implement safety protocols for working at height, dealing with live electrical lines, and mitigating environmental hazards. work closely with regulatory bodies to maintain current knowledge of relevant legislation and compliance updates. project management manage ohpl projects from planning to execution, ensuring timely completion within budget. coordinate with cross-functional teams, including civil engineers, project managers, and field crews, for seamless project execution. prepare and present project reports, budgets, schedules, and progress updates to stakeholders. technical support and training provide technical guidance and support to junior engineers, field staff, and contractors. conduct training sessions on best practices, equipment handling, and safety protocols for overhead power line operations. emergency response and troubleshooting respond to power outages and other emergencies, working quickly to restore service. analyze the root cause of faults or failures in the overhead line system and implement corrective actions. qualifications: education: bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering or a related field; a master’s degree is a plus. experience: 3+ years of experience in ohpl design, installation, and maintenance. certifications: professional engineer (pe) license is preferred; osha certification is a plus. skills: proficient in power system analysis software, cad, strong understanding of nesc and osha regulations, and excellent troubleshooting skills. job type: full-time pay: ﷼999.00 - ﷼1,000.00 per month education: bachelor's (preferred)

name: Denodo

description: country: sa city: riyadh job category: customer success denodo is a leader in data management. the award-winning denodo platform is the leading data integration, management, and delivery platform using a logical approach to enable self- service bi, data science, hybrid/multi-cloud data integration, and enterprise data services. realizing more than 400% roi and millions of dollars in benefits, denodo’s large enterprise and mid-market customers across 30+ industries have received payback in less than 6 months. for more information, visit www.denodo.com. we are a fast-growing, international organization with teams across four continents and we work with a cutting-edge technology, but that's not all we have to offer. at denodo, we are like a family and it is of the utmost importance to us that we help support your professional growth every step of the way. job description denodo is always looking for technical, passionate people to join our customer success team. we want a professional who will travel, consult, develop, train and troubleshoot to enhance our clients’ journey around data virtualization. your mission: to help people realize their full potential through accelerated adoption and productive use of denodo solutions. in this role you will successfully employ a combination of high technical expertise and client management skills to conduct on-site and off-site consulting, product implementation and solutions development in either short or long-term engagements being critical point of contact for getting things done among denodo, partners and client teams. job responsibilities & duties obtain and maintain strong knowledge of the denodo platform, be able to deliver a superb technical pitch, including overview of our key and advanced features and benefits, services offerings, differentiation, and competitive positioning. constantly learn new things and maintain an overview of modern technologies. be able to address a majority of technical questions concerning customization, integration, enterprise architecture and general feature / functionality of our product. capable of building and/or leading the development of custom deployments based and beyond client’s requirements. provide timely, prioritized and complete customer-based feedback to product management, sales, support and/or development regarding client’s business cases, requirements and issues. train and engage clients in the product architecture, configuration, and use of the denodo platform. promote knowledge and best practices while managing deliverables and client expectations. manage client expectations, establish credibility at all levels within the client and build problem-solving partnerships with the client, partners and colleagues. provide technical consulting, training and support. develop white papers, presentations, training materials or documentation on related topics. desired skills & experience bs or higher degree in computer science or a related field, or equivalent experience in a similar role. 5+ years of demonstrated experience as a data engineer or a similar role, preferably in the data management or analytics software industry. solid understanding of sql and good grasp of relational and analytical database management theory and practice. experience in java software development, especially in the web and database fields. good knowledge of jdbc, xml and web services apis. excellent verbal and written communication skills to be able to interact with technical and business counterparts. must be fluent/native in arabic and english. active listener. strong analytical and problem solving abilities. lots of curiosity. you never stop learning new things. creativity. we love to be surprised with innovative solutions. be a team worker with positive attitude. non-mandatory skills ( nice to have) experience working with git or other version control systems. experience working with big data and/or nosql environments like hadoop, mongodb, etc., experience working with caching approaches and technologies such as jcs. experience in windows & linux (and unix) operating systems in server environments. business software implementation and integration projects (e.g. etl/data warehouse architectures, cep, bpm). integration with packaged applications (e.g. relational databases, sap, siebel, oracle financials, business intelligence tools, …). industry experience in supporting mission critical software components. experience in attending customer meetings and writing technical documentation. foreign language skills are a plus. denodo is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. denodo will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities in accordance with applicable law. we do not accept resumes from headhunters or suppliers that have not signed a formal fee agreement. therefore, any resume received from an unapproved supplier will be considered unsolicited, and we will not be obligated to pay a referral fee.

base, asp.net, api’s, full stack environments, azure, development and deployment environments, epc procurement & logistics for project construction materials is essential. this role is required to work with the various solutions architects within the various planning and project functions to consolidate business wide data for the purpose of consistency, efficiency and real time reporting. accountable for ensuring a efficient centralized data environment is developed and maintained in a documented and auditable, and controlled manner. responsibilities acts as the focal point for centralization of project data and identifying areas of best practice and driving continuous improvement within the planning team. project planning: develop comprehensive data model for centralizing project logistics data in collaboration with the central planning team and regional project planning managers for the purpose of robust logistics volumes forecasting, including construction packages, resource loaded logistics volumes, procurement timelines, resource loaded estimation volumes, resource loaded volumes secured with po, actual volumes against the packages. review and maintain planning control structures are developed and maintained in alignment with approved project work breakdown structure (wbs). review and maintain baseline project plans through project lifecycle using primavera p6, assess and communicate schedule impact of change notifications. stakeholder management: liaise weekly updates and reviews with the central and regional project planning managers to analyze data quality, and impact of project plans and schedules on business requirements. liaise with solution architects, central planning manager, cost management, estimating, finance, power bi reporting specialist, company system integration specialists. risk management: identify potential risks, develop risk mitigation strategies, and proactively address issues to ensure smooth project execution and minimize disruptions to road freight operations. team leadership: lead and motivate project teams, provide guidance, assign tasks, and foster a collaborative work environment to achieve project goals. quality assurance: implement quality control measures and monitor adherence to operational standards, compliance requirements, and industry regulations. performance monitoring and reporting: monitor overall project progress status, achievement of major milestones, and evaluate performance in relation to planned performance. establish project performance metrics, track progress, generate reports, and provide regular updates to stakeholders on project status, milestones, and key performance indicators. continuous improvement: identify process improvement opportunities, drive operational efficiency, and recommend innovative solutions to enhance road freight operations, reduce costs, and optimize service delivery. industry knowledge: stay updated with industry trends, technological advancements, and best practices in road freight operations to drive innovation and maintain a competitive edge. educational qualifications & certifications bachelor’s degree in software engineering, data science, information technology, or a related technical field. competencies proven experience in planning management within the epc project management industry. strong knowledge of microsoft sql server, excel, c# programming, asp.net, full stack environments, azure, windows server development and deployment environments, penetration testing, micro services architecture, oracle and sap integration, logistics freight forwarder integration (edc api), catalog management & requisition boq, epc material procurement steps excellent organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills. effective communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with diverse stakeholders. ability to work under pressure, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines. leadership qualities with the ability to inspire and motivate teams. dsv – global transport and logistics dsv is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. we conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. when you join dsv, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. you’ll join a talented team of approximately 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. dsv aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms. we promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. if you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career. visit dsv.com

name: Air Products
title: Plant Process Engineer (Modelling and Optimisation)
description: at air products, our purpose is to bring people together to reimagine what’s possible, collaborate and innovate solutions to the world’s most significant energy and environmental sustainability challenges. grow with us as we embark on building tomorrow together by being the safest, most diverse and most profitable industrial gas company in the world. reimagine what’s possible the jazan igcc is the world’s largest igcc and asu facility producing 2100 mmscfd syngas, 18,000 mt/day oxygen and 4 gigawatts of power. facilities and assets include; residue gasification, acid gas clean up (rectisol), soot ash recovery, sulphur recovery (claus & scot), combined cycle power plants, materials handling systems, hydrogen recovery, air separation, water utilities systems and waste water treatment facilities. we require a process engineer with the ability to understand our process and its operational performance through strong first principals knowledge of chemical engineering, process modelling and analysis of plant data. you will use this to understanding to support the production planning process, optimise the operation against the commercial drivers, to identify improvement opportunities and benchmark performance. this will be done in the dynamic environment of facility commissioning and early operation. requirements of the role produce process models of plants and subsystems using excel, process simulation software (with aspen being the current preferred process simulation software) and other specialist packages improve existing process models, including the assimilation of plant operating/performance test data. produce the tools needed by the production planning department to estimate utility usage and feedstock requirements for a given product slate. analyse plant data to identify optimized operating regimes and strategies to meet the commercial objectives, and evaluate the performance of implemented projects. work closely with operations team, taking feedback, monitoring actual vs advised operating configuration and parameters and providing training. identify the root cause of performance/operability problems in commissioning and early operations through analysis of operating data and recommend appropriate solutions. undertake modelling of both continuous and batch processing units. ability to interpret design documents such as pfd, p&id, control narratives and operating instructions produce kpi reporting structures for the operations management and planning teams and written reports and presentations of investigations undertaken. work with the advanced process control team, to identify optimization methods and parameters for controlling to, and to evaluate performance of advanced control routines. the above experience will have ideally been gained in an operating plant environment or supporting commissioning environment with an epc/licensor/oem or as consulting service provider. required personal attributes the applicant must have a strong safety focus commercial understanding strong communication skills from board operator to plant manager level able to work independently, with the self-confidence to highlight concerns and propose the solutions. able to communicate effectively across different cultural norms and with non-native english speakers. work efficiently as part of a multidisciplinary team. the applicant will have a minimum of a bachelors degree in chemical engineering. a minimum of 10 years' experience, 5 of which is gained in a role related to this position ideally have experience of 1 or more of the process technologies utilised at the jazan igcc. we are the world’s largest hydrogen producer with over 80 years of industrial gas experience. we are hydrogen and industrial gas experts delivering safe, end-to-end solutions, investing in real, clean energy projects at scale, and driving the industry forward to generate a cleaner future. at air products, we work in an environment where we put safety first, diversity is essential, inclusion is our culture, and each person knows they belong and matter. to learn more, visit about air products.

name: AECOM
title: Senior Quantity Surveyor
description: company description work with us. change the world. at aecom, we're delivering a better world. whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. we are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations. there has never been a better time to be at aecom. with accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. we invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of over 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world. we're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. join us. job description normally receives little instruction on routine work, general instructions on new assignments. conducts surveys to ascertain the locations of natural features and human-made structures on the earth's surface, underground, and underwater, using electronic distance-measuring equipment and other surveying instruments. operates and manages land-information computer systems, performs tasks such as storing data, making inquiries, and producing plots and reports. reviews information from survey teams regarding measurement of distances, directions, angles between points and elevation of points, lines, and contours on, above, and below the earth’s surface. researches legal records, looks for evidence of previous boundaries, and analyzes the data to determine the location of boundary lines. records the results of surveys, verifies the accuracy of data, and prepares plots, maps, and reports. an experienced professional with full understanding of area of specialization. works on problems name: Fugro
title: Junior Geotechnical Engineer
description: job description job title: junior geotechnical engineer job summary: we are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented junior geotechnical engineer to join our team. the ideal candidate will be a fresh graduate with a bachelor’s degree in civil engineering, eager to learn and contribute to various geotechnical projects. key responsibilities: assist in the planning and execution of geotechnical investigations and surveys. conduct site visits to collect soil and rock samples and perform field tests. analyze data and prepare reports on soil properties and site conditions. collaborate with senior engineers to design foundations, retaining structures, and other geotechnical systems. support the preparation of project proposals and technical documentation. participate in project meetings and communicate findings effectively. stay updated on industry standards, regulations, and best practices. qualifications: bachelor’s degree in civil engineering. strong understanding of geotechnical engineering principles. excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. strong written and verbal communication abilities. ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. disclaimer for recruitment agencies: fugro does not accept any unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies. acquisition to fugro recruitment or any fugro employee is not appreciated.

name: Alaan
title: General Manager, KSA
description: about alaan we are an ai-powered expense management platform designed to simplify finance for businesses in the middle east, helping them save both time and money. our platform offers everything businesses need to manage and control their expenses in one place, including smart corporate cards, ai-powered automation and insights, streamlined accounting, and centralized dashboards. since 2022, over 800 businesses in the uae—from startups to enterprises like al barari, rove, rivoli, punjab national bank, and carswitch—have used alaan to control their spending and reduce costs. together, our customers have saved over aed 100 million using alaan. why alaan? exponential growth (literally!) growing 20% month on month with significant recent acceleration the only fintech in the middle east to be funded by y combinator in 2023 (the top 1% in the selection process) more than $7m in funding raised so far rated number 1 on g2 in the spend management category in the mena region amazing team parthi, ceo and co-founder, was an engineer, banker, and mckinsey consultant in london and dubai before starting alaan karun, head of product and tech, and co-founder, was also an engineer and a mckinsey consultant in dubai before starting alaan the rest of the team is a high-performing combination of people from companies such as careem, goldman sachs, bcg, etc about the role we are looking for a general manager to lead alaan in ksa, who will act as the default ceo for saudi operations. the role will require working directly with the founders and being at the forefront of a rocket ship. what you'll do your overall mission will be to oversee and manage our operations in ksa with a strong focus on formulating and executing strategies to drive growth you will be responsible for driving business growth, ensuring operational efficiency, and maintaining strong relationships with key stakeholders including clients, regulators, partners and technology vendors you will be the primary point of contact for all things ksa what we are looking for super-driven, with a 'do whatever it takes' attitude relentlessly resourceful, fast learner with a grit and hustle mindset hands-on and eagerness to implement operational strategies and plans a serious degree of customer obsession to truly solve a problem for our customers. data-driven mentality and analytical thinker fluent in arabic (read, write and speak) experience of working in ksa what's in it for you generous equity compensation to bring a high degree of ownership into your work, as alaan grows, you grow with it contribute to building the middle east’s most beloved fintech brand from the ground up benefit from a role with significant ownership and accountability thrive in a flexible hybrid culture with ample work-life balance participate in exciting offsite events enjoy additional perks like travel allowances, gym memberships, and more (that you will determine for our saudi employees)

name: Hudson Manpower
title: Engineer III, Process Role: ENG-PR-09-I1 Engineer III, Process
description: hello, my name is abhimanyu, and i’m a recruiter at hudsonmanpower. please review the job description below, and if you're interested, feel free to call me at 9172407852 or reply to this email abhimanyu@hudsonmanpower.com with your availability. i’ll be happy to provide more details about the interview process and the next steps. job purpose as an experienced process engineer performs tasks requiring the selection and application of a range of standard technical problem technical problem solving techniques, monitoring and analysis. job summary as an experienced process engineer, undertakes assignments of varying scope and complexity involving a range of standard technical problem solving techniques and computational methods, assisting more senior professionals who will at all times provide some supervision and guidance based on detailed work review. certifications working towards chartered/professional engineer qualification or membership job responsibilities 1.maintains high hse standards and seeks to ensure a healthy, safe work environment and working practices at all times 2.validates standard internal and 3rd party process design work for conformance with established standards and procedures. 3.reviews and evaluates technical bid proposals for engineering work, evaluates and reports conclusions, noting bid deviations 4.escalates emerging and complex plant issues to more senior engineers to ensure action is taken to resolve on a timely basis. 5.participates in projects; aligns tasks to project schedules/plans ensuring delivery within time ,cost and quality constraints. 6.reviews and analyses relevant plant, process and engineering data and recommends changes required to optimize operations. 7.provides guidance and support to help more junior team members. 9.carries out conventional engineering tasks requiring broad application of engineering knowledge, regulations and standards. develops a range of engineering plans and supporting documentation seeking guidance from senior level engineers as required. competencies: competencies working collaboratively embracing change achieving results chemical engineering: proficiency level 2 analysis and problem solving: proficiency level 2 creativity & innovation: proficiency level 1 statistical analysis and measurement: proficiency level 2 critical thinking and decision making: proficiency level 2 operations support services: proficiency level 3 developing capability education: degree or diploma combined with relevant experience experience: 5 years experience with degree or 10 years experience with diploma is desirable

name: Dar Al Riyadh
title: Autocad Draftsman
description: responsibilities: develop detailed drawings and plans for infrastructure projects using autocad, adhering to project requirements and specifications. work closely with engineers and project managers to translate conceptual designs into accurate technical drawings. create and modify drawings for infrastructure components such as roadways, drainage systems, pipelines, bridges, and other utilities. ensure compliance with local regulations, industry standards, and project requirements in all drafting activities. collaborate on multiple projects within a pmc environment, coordinating with multidisciplinary teams to align project goals and timelines. review and revise drawings based on feedback from engineers, architects, and clients to ensure final deliverables meet all specifications. maintain organized records of drawings and revisions, following proper documentation procedures. perform quality checks on drawings and identify any errors or inconsistencies to ensure accuracy. site coordination and field verification: conduct occasional site visits to verify drawing accuracy, collect on-site data, and understand real-world constraints that affect design. ensure that all drawings conform to pmc and client standards, including layer management, dimensioning, and line weights, to maintain a consistent and professional standard across all projects. develop 3d models for infrastructure components, such as roadways, utility corridors, and structures, using civil 3d or other compatible software to assist in project visualization and coordination. conduct detailed checks to ensure all drawings meet quality standards and are free of errors, using quality control processes to minimize revisions and improve accuracy. communicate with subcontractors and suppliers to ensure that the drawings reflect all necessary details for procurement, fabrication, and installation. assist engineers in calculating material quantities and other key measurements based on drawings to support cost estimation and project planning. organize and maintain a well-structured digital library of drawings and project documents to ensure easy retrieval and reference throughout the project lifecycle. maintain a systematic approach to tracking and documenting all drawing revisions, ensuring project stakeholders are aware of any updates or changes. review and incorporate “redline” comments from engineers and supervisors, making updates to drawings quickly to reflect any design changes or field modifications. collaborate with other disciplines (e.g., structural, electrical, and mechanical) to ensure accurate integration of all infrastructure elements within the drawing set. prepare utility mapping and relocation plans to prevent clashes and conflicts in coordination with other infrastructure projects. prepare and finalize as-built drawings based on final construction details and specifications for project handover and future reference. assist in the development of drafting and design standards for the pmc, ensuring a streamlined and standardized approach to all drafting practices. use project management software (like primavera, ms project, or other pmc tools) to update drawing schedules, submission timelines, and any dependencies in the project.ensure that all designs consider safety and environmental impact as per pmc policies and local regulations, incorporating sustainable design practices when possible. essential requirements: minimum of 10 years of experience in autocad drafting for infrastructure projects. experience working on pmc (project management consultancy) projects is highly desirable. proficiency in autocad and other relevant drafting software, with strong knowledge of infrastructure components. excellent attention to detail to ensure the accuracy and quality of drawings. strong communication skills to collaborate effectively with engineers, project managers, and other stakeholders. familiarity with industry standards and regulations related to infrastructure and civil engineering projects. diploma or associate degree in civil engineering, drafting, or a related field (preferred).

name: Siemens Energy
title: Service Lead Electrical & Commissioning Engineer - Siemens Energy, Dammam KSA
description: a snapshot of your day we are seeking a highly skilled and experienced professional with a strong technical background in mv/lv drives, generators, and motors. the ideal candidate will have extensive experience with sinamics drives and/or masterdrives, simatic step7, tia-portal, communication protocols profibus & profinet, and siemens hmi systems. knowledge of siemens protection relays siprotec is an added advantage. the role involves providing technical expertise, ensuring customer satisfaction, and collaborating with various stakeholders to deliver excellent service. how you’ll make an impact provide technical expertise in the selection, engineering, and commissioning of vfds and related components. analyze system logs, diagnose issues, and make data-driven decisions to resolve problems efficiently. interact with customers, colleagues, and other stakeholders to clearly articulate technical concepts, provide instructions, and communicate updates or resolutions effectively. ensure customer satisfaction by understanding and addressing customer needs and delivering excellent service. collaborate with other engineers, technicians, and departments to share knowledge and contribute to the collective success of the service operation. manage multiple tasks simultaneously, including scheduled maintenance, urgent repairs, and customer support. complete a broad scope of technical tasks including service, installation/commissioning, maintenance, and evaluation of customers' equipment and systems. determine priorities of tasks and actions and schedule measures accordingly. support customers remotely and onsite, providing support in case of arising issues. provide training to customers on how to use and maintain electrical equipment. involve in technical design and developments for service offerings. identify new business opportunities and develop relationships with potential customers. respond promptly to incidents, investigate, and provide temporary and/or permanent resolution of incidents escalated. what you bring bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, electronics, or instrumentation engineering. 5-8 years of work experience in engineering and commissioning of projects. strong technical knowhow of siemens make vfds (s120 / g120 / master drives / etc) with engineering and commissioning experience. very good knowhow of plc system and pcs-7 (dcs) is a must. experience in handling projects involving multi-cultural, multi-national/regional, diverse groups. strong technical knowhow on various products and systems such as switchgears, motors, vfds, plc, hmi, pcs, etc. excellent problem-solving abilities to identify the root cause of problems, develop effective solutions, and implement them in a timely manner. strong written and spoken communication skills for coordinating with various internal and external stakeholders. fluent in english (written and oral). willingness to travel to sites and travel on short notice, with the ability to handle flexible working hours on a demand basis and work under pressure onsite & offsite. preferred skills: knowledge of siemens protection relays siprotec. experience in providing training to customers. ability to identify new business opportunities and develop relationships with potential customers. about the team we are a highly motivated team that takes pride in its work and is known for delivery results. within our growth and development program, we nurture our competencies by providing continuous career coaching, trainings, and mentoring, all whilst working with senior management on high-profile engagements around the world. our culture is defined by caring, agile, respectful, authentic, and accountable individuals. we value excellence of any kind. who is siemens energy? at siemens energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. we meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. with more than 92,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment. our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. we uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation. our commitment to diversity lucky for us, we are not all the same. through diversity we generate power. we run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. siemens energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. we energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences. https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo #li-ns3

name: Emerson
title: Quality Manager
description: job summary: successful candidate will be responsible for incoming receiving inspection, in process and final inspection for control equipment in jubail factory and perform qa/qc related transactions in oracle including part validations. also, to support in maintenance of quality management, safety, environmental & lean manufacturing systems, supplier quality management, preparation quality procedures, driving improvement and determining corrective actions. they will report directly to the plant qhse manager and work with the team for implementing and improving quality matrices, lead time improvements and implementing lean processes. role responsibilities a) quality engineer: read and understand customer/internal specifications and international standards. carry out receiving inspection as per incoming inspection plans issue corrective action request to suppliers, follow up on the close-out review material test certificates, nde reports, valve & actuator certification pack etc. carry out in-process inspection like heat no. verification, pmi, hardness, paint dft etc. carry out final inspection and certification as per the po & approved documents perform oracle transactions in quality module coordination of customer inspection arranging the calibration of instruments and maintaining the records. maintaining/updating the iso documentations & records perform supplier quality control activities, audits, qualification renewal, maintaining records and updating new suppliers in worldwide qualified suppliers list assist mrb champion in closing rfts related to purchased part ncs or equivalent. issue rework form to the suppliers, coordinate/visit machine shops for the same prepare and furnish supplier ppm data in global quality sharepoint and mea provide machining related clarification to the new trim part suppliers in india and local rework machine shops preparation of standard operating procedures, quality alerts, safety instructions/initiatives lead the scar status in mea quality share point, review the effectiveness of ca provided by the suppliers and close the same. co-ordinate with the respective world area sqe on delayed scars. participate in supplier qbrs, travel to suppliers’ site for audits and training prepare project specific surface preparation & painting procedures train and qualify painters in jubail and maintain qualification records of the same review project painting specifications for new projects & provide clarification on all painting related queries from pm and oe for flow controls co-ordinating with shop on inspection and testing done in-house and report as required by the order (dft, mek, dolly pull off, x cut, salt contamination, dust test, holiday test etc...), supervising the blotter test and air pressure tests and verifying the records maintained. visiting external paint/coating shops/local suppliers for audits and quality checks as required offer paint dft and pmi inspection for client/tpi inspectors and issue reports and supporting documents participation in pim (all orders aramco direct and epc orders), kom, customer project specific visits support qp & spec function to review customer specifications related qms & factory tests review customer comments on qms & factory test procedures and provide resolution to project lead scheduling & handling sophisticated project witness stage inspections support all in pipe team for smooth execution of project verify finished equipment against ipo, using final inspection checklist create final certificate in qa docs for mro and projects review material certificates, as well as nde reports and test reports against ps codes, customer documentation & special requirements review factory test results against ipo plan, notify, offer completed products for customer inspection raise non-conformance and follow up for corrective action and close out. review root cause & corrective actions to ensure effectiveness of actions liaise with third party inspectors for witnessing of inspection and ensure inspection requirements from customer are met. part number validation in oracle take ownership of company’s quality policy & core values b) ehs consider ehs risks in decision-making and model safety as a core value every day. work in accordance with emerson’s 12 lifesaving behaviors at all times. report ehs concerns and/or unsafe conditions or unsafe approach immediately to a supervisor and raise further, as needed. stop work when conditions pose the risk of harm to people, property, or the environment. report all injuries immediately, regardless of the severity. as vital, complete applicable safety training. understand and implement safety-related responsibilities, as outlined in training, safety procedures, policies, and standards. use only equipment/chemicals/processes for which they have been trained. know the hazards of your job and follow your training to control associated risks. actively participate in ehs continuous improvement activities (e.g., safety & health audits, safety committees, focused improvement teams, process improvement projects, etc.). ensure effective leadership in hse, leading by example and setting the direction for a successful health and safety program and creating a foundation for a positive safety culture. discuss hse first in every meeting. ensure effective management of hse risks and impacts. report all hazards, incidents and near misses in line with the mea emerson hse incident policy. active involvement in the investigation of accidents, near misses, incidents and ill health where required. attend all hse training assigned to you as an employee 100% utilization of the emerson velocity ehs safety app who you are? conversant with valves, actuators, control accessories, automation and instrumentationndt – level ii asnt tc 1a certification in pt, mt, rt (film interpretation) techniques for this role, you will need: engineering degree or equivalent experience with 10+yrs, exp. in quality management in valve industry. knowledge in material specifications, nde, asme, iec, isa and fci standardsawareness of iso standards, api q1, api 609 monogram and root cause analysis preferred qualifications: bgas or nace paint inspector certification leak testing lean manufacturing, 5s, 8d knowledge of hse programs and equivalent experience conversant with saudi aramco specificationsstrong organizational and communication skills our offer to you! we recognize the importance of employee wellbeing and know that to do your best you have flexible, competitive benefit plans to meet you and your family’s physical, mental, financial, and social needs. we provide, a variety of medical insurance plans, employee assistance program, tuition reimbursement, employee resource groups, recognition, and much more. our culture prioritizes work-life balance and offers flexible time off plans, including paid parental leave (maternal and paternal), vacation and holiday leave. at emerson, we are committed to encouraging a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their outstanding experiences and perspectives. we believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that encourage innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers. the philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. learn more about our culture & values and about diversity, equity, & inclusion at emerson . our training programs and initiatives focus on end-to end development, from onboarding through senior leadership. we provide a wide range of development opportunities, including face-to-face and virtual training, mentorship, and coaching, project management, and on-the-job training adhere to health, safety & environment policies as laid by the organization

name: Nintex
title: IT Service Desk Analyst
description: about nintex: at nintex, we are transforming the way people work, everywhere. as the global standard for process intelligence and automation, we're trusted by over 10,000 public and private sector organizations across 90 countries. our customers, from industry giants like amazon, coca-cola, and microsoft, rely on the nintex platform to accelerate their digital transformation journeys by managing, automating, and optimizing business processes quickly and efficiently. we improve their lives through the technology we build. we are committed to fostering a workplace that supports amazing people in doing their very best work every day. collaboration is constant, our workplace is fun, the environment is fast-paced, and we value our people's curiosity, ideas, and enthusiasm. driven by passion and accountability, we take initiative, measure progress, and deliver results. our culture fosters innovation and problem-solving, fueled by curiosity and a commitment to thinking big. together, we move with agility, prioritize customer needs, and build unity through empathy, leaving a positive impact wherever we go. about the role: as part of the global it support team you will help provide a single point of contact to the enterprise for all technology related support needs. you will help fulfill daily support needs and maintain basic it operations as well as play a key role in our follow-the-sun support model that will take advantage of coverage across multiple time zones to provide timely service and support. you will be a point of escalation for complicated issues, lead or participate in it support projects and implementations and perform auditing activities to ensure accurate data is held in the various systems. your contribution will be: provide tier 1 support for enterprise end users for all technology related needs monitor ticketing system consistently and progress, escalate and resolve tickets efficiently using documented processes and critical thinking use incident classification guidelines to escalate high and critical priority tickets properly using the it incident management policy handoff any unfinished tickets to next support engineer on-shift assist with user onboarding procedures, including account setup, hardware setup/deployment, desk setup and user training manage our antivirus software to remove any active threats and ensure our endpoints are secure contribute to the global it support knowledge base by frequently updating, retiring and creating articles procure and configure required hardware for end-users support and maintain it-owned hardware, including proper decommissioning according to our soc2 requirements manage and track it assets using asset management system support and maintain av equipment in all areas of offices and externally as requested continuously improve support operations – analyzing operational data and use end user feedback to reduce downtime for end users, improve service turn time, and prevent end user incidents participate in team projects and provide timely and complete deliverables stay current with related technologies; recommend ways for nintex to improve productivity and reduce cost manage and lead projects for it support team, including participating in planning and execution of it projects and rollouts provide guidance and act as a level of escalation for others in the support team audit applications and systems (ad, asset management system, etc.) to analyze for compliance and changes that need to be made familiarize yourself with nintex products to help find ways that it support can leverage these systems to save time and cost to be successful, we think you need: what's in it for you? our people work in the way that best suits them and their teams - whether at home, in an office, or another place that sparks creativity, focus, and collaboration. our work environment is such that our people can successfully deliver their work while adequately supporting their lifestyle and preferences. while our offerings differ from country to country, we offer our entire global workforce an array of exciting perks and benefits, including global gratitude and recharge days flexible, paid time off policy employee wellness programs and counseling resources meaningful peer recognition and awards paid parental leave invention/patenting assistance community impact, paid volunteer time, and opportunities intercultural learning and celebration multiple tools through which to learn and grow, and an incredible global community view more about our benefits here: https://www.nintex.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/global-perks-and-benefits.pdf.

name: Qiddiya Investment Company
title: Senior Manager - Land Development (ENT436)
description: qiddiya investment company, a pioneer in the development of transformative entertainment and leisure experiences, is seeking a dedicated and skilled manager - land development to join our vibrant team. in this critical role, you will be responsible for managing the planning, execution, and delivery of land development projects that align with our strategic objectives. as the manager of land development, you will work closely with cross-functional teams, including architects, engineers, and urban planners, to drive projects from concept through completion. you will also play a key role in optimizing site plans, coordinating regulatory approvals, and ensuring compliance with all relevant land use policies and regulations. your leadership and attention to detail will ensure that our land development initiatives are not only innovative but also sustainable and impactful. responsibilities manage the day-to-day operations of land development projects, overseeing the planning, design, and execution phases. collaborate with internal teams and external consultants to develop and review comprehensive land use plans and community development plans. ensure projects adhere to established budgets and schedules, implementing effective management strategies to mitigate risks. coordinate with regulatory authorities to secure necessary permits and approvals, ensuring compliance with local zoning ordinances, building codes, and environmental regulations. conduct feasibility studies and market research to identify opportunities and challenges in land development. monitor project progress and performance, providing regular updates to senior management and stakeholders. use geographic information systems to analyze spatial data and create land use maps. develop and engineering/ material science/manufacturing engineering/industrial engineering with 1-3 years industrial experience
