the industry's largest service portfolio. you may recognize our products in some of the world’s most famous landmarks including the eiffel tower, empire state building, burj khalifa and the petronas twin towers! we are 69,000 people strong, including engineers, digital technology experts, sales, and functional specialists, as well as factory and field technicians, all committed to meeting the diverse needs of our customers and passengers in more than 200 countries and territories worldwide. we are proud to be a diverse, global team with a proven legacy of innovation that continues to be the bedrock of a fast-moving, high-performance company. when you join otis, you become part of an innovative global industry leader with a resilient business model. you’ll belong to a diverse, trusted, and caring community where your contributions, and the skills and capabilities you’ll gain working alongside the best and brightest, keep us connected and on the cutting edge. we provide opportunities, training, and resources, that build leadership and capabilities in sales, field, engineering and major projects and our employee scholar program is a notable point of pride, through which otis sponsors colleagues to pursue degrees or certification programs. today, our focus more than ever is on people. as a global, people-powered company, we put people – passengers, customers, and colleagues – at the center of everything we do. we are guided by our values that we call our three absolutes – prioritizing safety, ethics, quality in all that we do. if you would like to learn more about environmental, social and governance (esg) at otis click here . become a part of the otis team and help us #buildwhatsnext! otis is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. all any other federally protected class. to request an accommodation in completing an employment application due to a special need or a disability, please contact us at careers@otis.com .

name: Projects Pioneers Contracting Company
title: Lead Cost control Manager / Cost control Director
description: job title: senior cost manager location: dammam job summary: the cost lead manager is responsible for the financial planning, management, and tracking of project costs in a contracting company. they work closely with project managers, estimators, and procurement teams to control project expenses, ensure cost-efficiency, and support the delivery of projects within the defined financial parameters. the role requires excellent analytical skills, financial acumen, and a thorough understanding of construction industry practices. key responsibilities: budget management: develop and manage project budgets, ensuring cost control from project inception to completion. monitor project expenditures and compare them with initial estimates to ensure that the project stays within the budget. prepare periodic cost forecasts and variance analyses, reporting to senior management. cost estimation and control: collaborate with the estimating team to develop accurate project cost estimates. review and evaluate project costs on a continual basis, identifying areas for cost-saving and optimization. manage cost tracking systems, ensuring that all expenditures are recorded and monitored. financial reporting: prepare detailed financial reports and updates on project costs for both internal stakeholders and clients. present cost-related data to project teams and senior management in a clear and concise manner. report financial progress and flag potential risks to stakeholders. procurement and vendor management: liaise with procurement teams to ensure that subcontractor and supplier contracts are cost-effective. negotiate pricing and contract terms with vendors and subcontractors to maximize project profitability. manage vendor payment processes, ensuring accurate and timely payments. risk management: identify potential financial risks related to the project and develop mitigation strategies. perform cost risk assessments to proactively manage project finances. collaboration and communication: work closely with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and provide financial guidance. communicate cost-related matters clearly to non-financial stakeholders. compliance and auditing: ensure that all cost management processes comply with company policies, industry standards, and legal requirements. support internal and external audits by providing detailed financial documentation. qualifications and skills: educational background: bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, quantity surveying, construction management, or related fields. professional certifications (cma, cpa, or mrics) are a plus. experience: 15-18 years of experience in cost management or financial planning, ideally within the construction or contracting industry. proven track record of managing large-scale construction project costs. technical skills: proficiency in cost management software (sap, oracle, or procore). strong knowledge of cost estimation, budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting. excellent excel and financial modeling skills. key competencies: strong analytical skills and attention to detail. ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. excellent negotiation and communication skills. strong leadership and teamwork skills. job type: full-time pay: ﷼20.00 - ﷼25.00 per month

atkinsréalis is committed to eliminating discrimination and encouraging diversity amongst our workforce. we aim to provide quality and fairness for all job applicants and employees and not to complying with the relevant employment legislation and codes of practice. ensuring that all existing employees, potential employees, colleagues and customers are treated equally and with respect.

19,500 employees at the service of its clients and develops cutting-edge innovations accessible to all projects. through its wide range of activities, egis is a key player in the collective organisation of society and the living environment of citizens all over the world. with 3,500 employees across 8 countries in the middle east, egis has delivered over 700 complex development projects, stimulating economic growth and enhancing quality of life. ranked among the top ten firms in the middle east by engineering news record (enr), egis is committed to sustainable development. the group’s operations in the middle east are built on strategic acquisitions and a deep understanding of local market conditions. egis’ long history of providing comprehensive engineering, consulting, and project management services makes it a trusted partner for regional governments, investors, and developers. job description monitoring of project’s quality tasks, ensuring that every member of the project has the awareness of the quality requirements, quality management plan and procedures including specification and requirements. review the contractor’s quality management plan and procedure and provide feedback to quality manager on their status. review the contractor’s inspection and test plan (ipt)s, quality reports, site testing reports in compliance with quality requirements. provide guidance to the project manager and project engineers on the quality specific requirements, quality processes and improvement initiatives in the project. monitor the contractor’s qa/qc team performance at project, implementation of the contractor’s project quality plan, quality procedures at project and feedback to quality manager and project manager in case of any deviation. review contractor’s daily/weekly and monthly quality reports to ensure all data are verified, quality issues/ concerns are resolved per quality standards at project. preparing egis weekly/monthly reports and compare with contractor’s submitted reports and ensure all quality tasks, concerns, ncrs, audits etc. are recorded, reported and appropriate actions are taken on time. verify the implementation/ closure of the quality inspection/audit reports and comments in the project in coordination with contractor qa/qc team. responsible to issue ncr/car in the project in case of contract and quality deviations in coordination with project manager, verifying proper implementation and closure at project conduct audits on the project/ contractors per audit schedule to ensure the compliance with their plan, procedures, contract and quality requirements. liaison with the client’s representative on quality related issues during their visit participate in site and material inspections with project team to monitor the quality requirements are implemented per approved method statements and approved inspection and test plans. maintain project qa/qc documents, reports and records. name: Parsons
title: Principal Cost Engineer
description: job description: parsons is looking for an amazingly talented principal cost engineer to join our team! in this role you will be r esponsible for construction - wide cost control, cost estimation, forecasting input for project's budget plans, work control (work authorization and work release), and review of contractor's invoices. the senior cost engineer provides a major role in enforcing contractual responsibilities of the rc contractor's cost performance. within the framework of the assigned project area, he estimates, monitors and advises the rc contractor on cost, change order and invoice matters — collecting, evaluating, forecasting and estimating cost/ invoice data as requested by management. what you'll be doing: develops systems which provide construction department/srcms & srces with needed commercial analysis, budget allocation on various levels, cost estimation and invoice control information for the construction projects. responsible for directing the development, evaluation and consolidation of all cost engineering reports and cost control methods. responsible for construction department operations of the work control system (work authorization and work releases) including procedural development and contact with higher management and client. directs contractor through the pre & post-award conference and subsequent meetings on establishing a contract breakdown for progress monitoring, cash flow preparation, work estimate preparation, documentation requirements and other financial related matters. oversees the labor distribution for contractors. in conjunction with the wider construction department, establishes and negotiates new cost codes and tracks specific charges as required. prepares commitment and expenditure fiscal requirements forecast which eventually become the annual budget. performs variance analyses offering explanations for deviation from planned levels of commitments and expenditures. provides technical advice/reports on cost related or work control matters to management, provides historical manpower and annual implementation plan (aip) information on the projects since inception. reviews and validates contractor's work estimates, change order requests and invoices for accuracy, consistency and continuity of cost data. participates in field surveys of completed work to verify contractor claimed quantities on work estimates. established and maintains cost control tracking on unit price contracts — monitoring latest estimate-to complete quantities vs. contract quantities and alerting management of any potential overruns well before they occur. assists the senior resident construction manager in identifying, preparing and documenting change orders which affect cost. closely coordinates with the contractor's estimator on those estimates requiring his expertise. responsible for establishing the cvfc (contracts value forecast at completion by assigning trends to all forecast changes affecting cost, scope or schedule. responsible to alert management to any potential royal commission financial exposure relating to a particular contract be it due to contractor's financial instability, claims, over-billing or failing to follow contractual requirements and assists in the preparation and presentation of such events to higher management. responsible for updating relevant csr's (contract status reports) on all active contracts in the program progress report by indicating contract values, forecast values, scheduled and actual expenditures and percentage progress billed. responsible for updating forecast values of active contracts in the cost reimbursable/unit price contract report by incorporating potential modifications and updating actual expenditures. what required skills you'll bring: bachelor degree in engineering, construction, quantity surveying, project management, finance, business administration or any other related field. minimum 10 years of post-graduate experience in project cost estimation with at least 4 years of directly related senior cost engineering experience. a membership of professional association such as association of american cost engineers (aace) is desirable. possesses advanced arabic and english language skills, including strong oral and written communication abilities in both. must have or be able to obtain saudi drivers’ license. what desired skills you'll bring: contractually and commercially aware, familiar with proposals, construction, engineering and consultative projects knowledge of quality assurance certificates and systems (iso). experience in dealing with contractors/vendors/subcontractors and flexible when working to tight deadlines. relevant computer proficiency, experience in using microsoft package, and other relevant software (primavera or ms project). •time management, communication and interpersonal skills. minimum clearance required to start: not applicable/none parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. minority/female/disabled/protected veteran.

name: KBR
title: PSAB BOSS: HVAC Technician (Secret Clearance)
description: title: psab boss: hvac technician (secret clearance) belong, connect, grow, with kbr! program summary the kbr psab program provides comprehensive base operating support-installation (bos-i) services at prince sultan air base (psab) in the kingdom of saudi arabia (ksa). these services are delivered to support the 378 air expeditionary wing (aew), mission partners, and tenant units, encompassing a diverse range of personnel including transient, temporary duty (tdy), permanent party, and rotational personnel. additionally, the program extends its services to encompass five (5) remote army sites within psab. this program ensures the seamless functioning of operations, maintenance, and support activities essential for the sustained mission readiness and operational effectiveness of psab and its associated units. job summary the hvac technician shall ensure installation, operation, maintenance, and repairs of heating, ventilation, air conditioning and refrigeration (hvac/r) systems, combustion equipment, and industrial air compressors as well as maintain and repair nonelectric kitchen equipment. this position shall function as an integral team member, cooperating with and supporting u.s. deployed forces, kingdom of saudi arabia (ksa) and shall share information with other integral team members as required. roles and responsibilities as an hvac technician, you would ensure all contractual performance objectives are met. ensure the successful delivery of services to 4,000 personnel, plus or minus 10%, at all times. responsible for proper utilization, accounting, and safeguarding of all government and contractor provided property (e.g., to include government facilities, equipment tools, information, and data). ensure required contractual submittals are provided to the government. ensure compliance with all us laws, saudi labor law, us epa guidelines, final governing standards (fgs), overseas environmental baseline guidance document (oebgd), us building codes, department of defense (dod) unified facilities criteria (ufc), national electric code (nec), national electric safety code (nesc), occupational safety and health administration (osha) standards, national fire protection association (nfpa) and institute of electrical and electronics engineering (ieee) standards. in addition, ensure site activities comply with applicable us, dod, and host country codes and standards to include american society of heating, refrigerating, and air-conditioning engineers (ashrae), international plumbing code (ipc), national plumbing code (npc), building & fire codes concerning health, safety, and the environment in the design and construction of real property facilities at all times. performs other duties as assigned. material & equipment directly used: may be exposed to potentially hazardous conditions that require wear of hard hats, gloves, steel toed boots, hearing protection, safety glasses and other personal protection equipment (ppe); may be required to push, pull, and lift heavy equipment. use of land mobile radios, cell phones, laptops, and other devices to maintain contact and accountability of work activities. working environment: work will be indoors and outdoors. exposure to heat, cold, dust, noise, chemicals may occur. overtime and shift work may be required depending on contractual needs as well as occasional to frequent travel. employees must comply with all federal, state and local regulations and published company work rules as well as written instructions. task specific work environment training may be provided. must be prepared to function in a wartime or contingency environment to support u.s. interests. physical activities: physical requirements include lifting up to 35lb, team lifting up to 50lbs, climbing, extended sitting, or standing, stooping, stretching, and bending. work may require using and wearing personal protective equipment such as, hearing and eye protection, hard hat and steel-toed boots as well as individual protective equipment (ipe) which may include but not limited to level iii plus/iv individual body armor with both front and back ballistic plates, ach helmet, clothing (undergarments, shirts and pants and/or coveralls), reflective vests/belts, sound suppression devices, etc. day-to-day physical requirements may involve standard office activities including sitting/standing for extended periods of time, attending meetings, use of keyboard and mouse repetitively, lifting and carrying less than 20 lbs. frequently, etc. work requires moderate physical exertion including walking to operating areas and walking upstairs. basic qualifications high school diploma or equivalent with a minimum of 3-5 years relevant hvac/r experience with similar projects. commercial/industry hvac/r certification(s), completion of hvac/r vocational school, or graduate from a dod hvac/r tech school. must be a u.s. citizen with a current u. s. driver's license. must possess passport book (not passport card) with at least 15 months of remaining validity and 6 blank visa/stamp pages remaining. must have and maintain a valid u. s. secret security clearance. must be able to read, write, speak, and understand english fluently. candidates must also meet centcom mod-15 theater requirements. skills: mandatory knowledge on the principles of hvac/r systems, controls, and components; combustion systems; air and water balancing; nonelectric kitchen equipment; industrial air compressors. ability to interpret drawings and schematics. know and be able to apply the fundamentals of hvac/r equipment and troubleshooting techniques, industrial water treatment, environmental regulations for fuels, refrigerants, and hazardous materials. have knowledge on military and commercial publications and environmental regulations. pro-active, well organized, results-oriented, and team player with decision-making ability. use computers & related software such as microsoft office and other common products used in office environments. able and willing to work periods of long hours to meet mission requirements. excellent interpersonal and communication skills with documented supervisory experience. experience in contingency environments as well as knowledge & experience working with government contracts. preferred qualifications bachelor’s degree desired usaf hvac/r (3ex1) afcs and/or other similar military/dod mos hvac/r experience highly desired. kbr benefits kbr offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401k plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, ad&d, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. we support career advancement through professional training and development. inclusion and diversity at kbr at kbr, we are passionate about our people, sustainability, and our zero harm culture. these inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a more inclusive and diverse company. that commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment of real collaboration across cultures and locations. our individual differences and perspectives bring enhanced value to our teams and help us develop solutions for the most challenging problems. we understand that by embracing those differences and working together, we are more innovative, more resilient.

name: FINE GLOBAL HR
title: SOIL TECHNICIAN
description: job role collecting soil samples: soil technicians gather samples from different locations and depths for analysis. conducting laboratory tests: they perform tests to determine properties such as ph levels, nutrient content, texture, and composition (e.g., clay, sand, silt). analyzing results: based on lab tests, they interpret data to assess soil quality, fertility, drainage potential, and suitability for construction or agriculture. reporting findings: technicians document their results and often report findings to engineers, environmental scientists, or farmers to aid in decision-making. monitoring soil health: in some cases, they monitor soil contamination, erosion risks, or how soil might be affected by land use changes. experienced field: experience in construction material testing lab (concrete, soil and aggregate) no of years: at least with 2 years experience education: higher secondary salary ; 2300 sar and 200 food allowance joining ticket: will be provided for more details contact on : +966535674032/+917736838887 email: hr2@fineglobalhr.com job type: full-time pay: ﷼2,200.00 - ﷼2,500.00 per month

title: GEOTECHNICAL DRILLERS
description: location: saudi arabia key responsibilities: operate and maintain geotechnical drilling rigs and related equipment. perform soil, rock, and groundwater sampling using auger, rotary, and other drilling techniques. conduct in-situ testing, such as standard penetration tests (spt) and cone penetration tests (cpt). ensure compliance with safety regulations and best practices on-site. prepare borehole logs, drilling reports, and document subsurface conditions. work closely with geotechnical engineers to ensure accurate data collection. transport drilling equipment to and from job sites, and set up drilling locations. conduct routine maintenance and minor repairs on drilling equipment. requirements: qualification: 10th passed/iti/diploma experience: minimum 4 years experience in related field 8 hours duty/day, 6 days a week 2 years renewable contract benefits: salary: sar 3000 + ot accommodation, transportation & medical insurance provided by the company apply now: send your cv: hr2@fineglobalhr.com ,jobs@fineglobalhr.com contact: /+966535674032+91 77368 38887 job type: full-time pay: ﷼2,900.00 - ﷼3,000.00 per month

documentation, including schedules, progress reports, and meeting minutes. support change management processes by assessing the impact of scope changes on project schedules and budgets. analyze historical project data to inform future planning and decision-making processes. essential requirements: bachelor’s degree in civil engineering, construction management, or a related field; a master’s degree is preferred. minimum of 10 years of experience in project planning and scheduling, preferably in large-scale infrastructure or construction projects. proficiency in planning software (e.g., primavera p6, microsoft project) and strong analytical skills. excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders. strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make data-driven decisions. knowledge of project management methodologies and best practices. experience working in an international or multicultural environment is a plus.

name: Hewlett Packard

customers in over 170 countries on six continents. hp invents, engineers, and delivers technology solutions that drive business value, create social value, and improve the lives of our clients. at hp, name: Cisco Systems
title: Pre-Sales Solutions Engineer - AI, Riyadh
description: what you’ll do we are seeking a solutions engineer - artificial intelligence (ai) to join our dynamic sales team. as an se (ai), you will drive the adoption of our ai solutions across various industries. you will identify potential clients, understand their specific needs, and provide tailored ai solutions that enhance their business operations. this role requires a deep understanding of ai technologies and experience relaying technical concepts to a diverse audience. who you’ll work with the cloud + ai infrastructure team delivers one scalable strategy with local execution for data center customer transformation and growth. we are the worldwide go-to-market compute and data center networking engine gathering market transitions and allowing sellers to expand growth for customers and cisco. who you are you will build awareness, foster education, and drive energy for ai with both internal and external team members, partners, etc. you will also act as a link between technical teams, account teams, executives, partners/customers. also, you will showcase ai solutions/products, its potential and promote its tactical and technical responsibilities. you will play an important role in the design, development and promotion of ai solutions and address challenges. you will need to travel as needed to meet with clients and attend industry events. minimum qualifications: 6+ years of technical presales experience selling compute, storage, and network solutions. proficiency in python (must), mysql, github, git, go, etl, olap, rdbms, scribus, aws, azure, google, ibm cloud, or other platforms and programming languages. experienced with databases (oracle, postgresql, mysql, mongodb, cassandra, redis, snowflake, bigquery) working practical experience with ai/ml frameworks (scikit-learn, tensorflow, pytorch, hugging face). excellent presentation skills – ability to deliver engaging workshops to both technical and non-technical audiences on ai topics ability to provide detailed and consumable documentation of standard methodologies for deployment around application acceleration, automation/management efficiencies, enterprise edge, and ai/ml solutions. preferred qualifications bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, or related field. advanced degree is a plus. ai experience with nvidia, ibm, microsoft, dell, netapp, hpe, and/or other ai vendors in-depth understanding of language models, including but not limited to gpt-3, bert, or similar architectures. familiarity with containerization technologies (e.g., docker or equivalent experience) and orchestration tools (e.g., kubernetes) for scalable and efficient model deployment why cisco? #wearecisco. we are all unique, but collectively we bring our talents to work as a team, to develop innovative technology and power a more inclusive, digital future for everyone. how do we do it? well, for starters – with people like you! nearly every internet connection around the world touches cisco. we’re the internet’s optimists. our technology makes sure the data traveling at light speed across connections does so securely, yet it’s not what we make but what we make happen which marks us out. we’re helping those who work in the health service to connect with patients and each other; schools, colleges, and universities to teach in even the most challenging of times. we’re helping businesses of all shapes and sizes to connect with their employees and customers in new ways, providing people with access to the digital skills they need and connecting the most remote parts of the world – whether through 5g, or otherwise. we tackle whatever challenges come our way. we have each other’s backs, we recognize our accomplishments, and we grow together. we celebrate and support one another – from big and small things in life to big career moments. and giving back is in our dna (we get 10 days off each year to do just that). we know that powering an inclusive future starts with us. because without diversity and a dedication to equality, there is no moving forward. our 30 inclusive communities, that bring people together around commonalities or passions, are leading the way. together we’re committed to learning, listening, caring for our communities, whilst supporting the most vulnerable with a collective effort to make this world a better place either with technology, or through our actions. so, you have colorful hair? don’t care. tattoos? show off your ink. like polka dots? that’s cool. pop culture geek? many of us are. passion for technology and world changing? be you, with us! #wearecisco message to applicants applying to work in the u.s. and/or canada: when available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in u.s. and/or canada locations, not including equity or benefits. for non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their u.s. or canada hiring location. the recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process. u.s. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings. employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday, plus a day off for their birthday. employees accrue up to 20 days of paid time off (pto) each year and have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues without tapping into their pto. we offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community. employees are also able to purchase company stock through our employee stock purchase program. employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. for quota-based incentive pay, cisco typically pays as follows: .75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota; 1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%; 1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and once performance exceeds 100% attainment, incentive rates are at or above 1% for each 1% of attainment with no cap on incentive compensation. for non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, cisco may pay up to 125% of target. cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

name: 21Tech, LLC
title: AI Solutions Architect
description: 21tech, llc. is seeking an ai solutions architect to join our company. our team has broad experience implementing and maintaining enterprise asset management (eam) solutions in the public sector. 21tech, llc is the key go-to partner of hexagon/infor in the public sector across the us and canada. 21tech's consultants are not just experts in the field of asset management, but they are experts at consulting in general. we offer a competitive and desirable benefits package. location: remote job description: the ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing artificial intelligence (ai) solutions that align with our business needs and goals. responsibilities: ● analyze the needs of the client or organization and determine how ai solutions can best meet those needs ● training and mentoring team members on ai technologies and solution development. ● design, build, and test ai models to ensure they function as expected ● develop ai software and platforms to meet specific needs ● oversee and guide the implementation of ai solutions within the organization or for the client ● work with data scientists and other stakeholders to ensure ai solutions are effectively integrated and utilized ● monitor the performance of ai systems and make necessary adjustments ● stay updated with latest developments and advancements in ai and machine learning ● provide technical leadership and guidance on ai matters ● document the architecture and design of ai solutions for future reference and maintenance ● ensure compliance with data privacy and protection regulations when building and implementing ai solutions ● design, develop, and implement ai applications. ● collaborate with data scientists and engineers to translate requirements into ai architecture and systems. ● recommend appropriate tools, technologies, and methodologies for ai development projects. ● evaluate and optimize ai systems and applications to ensure efficiency and effectiveness. ● stay abreast of the latest developments in ai and ml fields. ● ensure compliance with ai ethical guidelines and standards. ● provide technical leadership and support to the ai development team. ● coordinate with business stakeholders to understand their goals and determine how ai technologies can be leveraged to meet them. skills: ● proven experience as an ai solutions architect or similar role in ai/ml development projects. ● skilled in data extraction, transformation, and load (etl) processes. ● deep understanding of ai, ml, deep learning, and data science like aws, google cloud, or azure. ● excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. ● strong communication and team management skills. ● master’s degree in computer science, ai, ml, or a related implementations as well as business processes improvement initiatives. we also provide system integration services for infor/hexagon products such as eam, csf, wfm, etc. our clients range from the world’s top transit agencies, large cities and municipalities, and many more. job type: full-time work location: remote

systems. establishing and updating testing schedule, in accordance with overall schedule managing test equipment at site such as: digital multi-meters, injection sets, watt-meters, etc., and ensure arabic minimum 7 years working experience as a testing and commissioning engineer in a similar industry. familiar with specialized in protection & control, sub-station protectionincluding: all protection panels for different voltage levels 400/132/33/11kv (busbar prot. line prot., bs prot., bc prot., transformer prot. scheme check, stability, load shedding, capacitors prot..etc.). strong knowledge in all control panels for different level (incl. avr, abts, accs, amr), and others. good knowledge to prepare interface ( cid ) files with sas systems ability to influence internal stakeholders and functions laterally and upwards to achieve common project goals ability to succinctly communicate to senior leadership key project issues with appropriate visual aids ability to create genuine team dynamics and shared ownership of project goals ability to project self as true leader of the project and ultimate collaborative decision maker desired characteristics ability to manage customer, partner and external relations under pressure while remaining mindful of business/project goals strong sense of urgency & drive for results natural instinct to be a change agent and contribute to wider business operational improvement/evolution initiatives additional information relocation assistance provided: no

name: Noon Academy
title: Head of Learning
description: about noon: noon academy is the leading edtech platform in the middle east, with over 12 million students and teachers using our app to learn, teach, and collaborate. we have recently raised $41 million in series b funding to expand our reach and impact in the region and beyond. we are on a mission to transform the physical classroom experience by introducing our highly engaging social, group-based learning and ai to make learning fun and improve learning efficacy. our ultimate goal is to provide access to the best teachers to every student even if that teacher is only available virtually. we believe we can do this if we blend ai, peer-to-peer learning, and a carefully designed physical space. hear it directly from our ceo and co-founder: this office: this role is full-time and riyadh-based, where we have a sweet office near the boulevard. about the role: this is a critical leadership role responsible you'll build a learning ecosystem for your dedicated school model, which spans multiple campuses. our primary focus may be helping students succeed in the qudrat exam, but our mission goes much deeper. we aim to prepare students for life beyond school by fostering a mindset shift—from passively going through the motions to actively owning their educational journey. your role will be a perfect blend of data-driven strategy and leading team to engage teachers in professional development to improve content, delivery, planning & pedagogical practices in a hybrid environment you'll be a champion for our students. what you’ll do: architecting and continuously enhancing an ai-driven and hybrid learning ecosystem that measurably outpaces traditional education, backed by tangible gains in student achievement data introducing thought-leadership on best learning practices in noon’s hybrid learning environment leading team to engage teachers in professional development to improve content, delivery, planning & pedagogical practices in a hybrid environment elicit feedback from students to continuously improve the learning process challenges, and successes, using these insights to drive continuous improvement of the learning ecosystem supporting in evaluating the impact and outcomes of your solutions and iterating based on feedback and data. collaborating with product managers, engineers, designers, and business operations leads to turning insights into hypotheses and translating them to make product and learning enhancement and deliver measurable impact for our students. responsible for the “education strategy”, curriculum design, and content development operations your expertise? at least a bachelor’s degree ideally from a top-tier and well reputed university strong understanding of learning principles, pedagogical practices and data-driven educational approaches previous experience in an educational role, e.g. teaching, school administration, instructional / learning design, curriculum / content development, training, etc. will be preferred proven ability to communicate complex educational and technical concepts to diverse audiences experience leading cross-functional teams and managing complex projects a saudi national (preferred) and fluent in english and arabic highly emotionally intelligent - can quickly bond with stakeholders, e.g. teachers and gain their trust has a lot of drive - energy+determination to achieve something with barriers in the way and in unfamiliar territory passionate about technology and consumer-facing products, and can demonstrate that through personal projects, internships, or work experience. proficient in using various tools and techniques to tell stories: sketches, videos, presentations, written documents. (preferred) experienced working in international team settings about the benefits in addition to a competitive base salary, we offer 21 days annual leave full premium medical coverage including family dependent income protection and life assurance to help you to protect your future why work at noon? we have good runway: recently closed series b and have substantial recurring revenue. we are mission and values driven. we take our values seriously. we have a strong leadership team that you can learn a lot from. if that sounds like your kind of challenge, we’re eager to chat and see if you’re the missing piece in our puzzle! please do apply through this job link and we will try our best to get back to you!

name: BAE Systems
title: WOME Compliance Manager
description: weapons, ordnance, munitions & explosives (wome) engineering manager salary: competitive grade: gg12 location: riyadh, saudi arabia job purpose bae systems is the uk government’s nominated prime contractor under the government-to-government arrangements that are in place to provide equipment, support and training to saudi arabia. we provide maintenance of royal saudi air force (rsaf) aircraft and train rsaf and royal saudi naval force personnel safely in a training environment in how to use their aircraft, equipment and weapons. bae systems saudi arabia is committed to supporting the saudi arabian national agenda including saudisation and the training and development of saudi national capability through the growth of the saudi national partner companies thereby reinforcing industrialisation and partnerships. the wome engineering manager will support the head of wome in undertaking wome engineering and safety governance, updating and maintaining the wome exposition, processes and procedures to demonstrate compliance with the bae systems corporate requirements and meet the uk and customer legislative, regulatory, standards requirements for weapons & explosives. the wome engineering manager will ensure that the systems engineering tools are successfully deployed and maintained across the wome domain with appropriate tailoring as required job accountabilities the post holder is responsible for: deputise for the head of wome as required; management of their direct reports; sharing best practice throughout bae systems saudi arabia (baessa) and the kpcs in order to promote continuous improvement within the wome sector, as well as the corresponding areas within the other organisations; development, assessment and implementation of wome engineering processes, procedures and tools to meet current and future business needs, ensuring compliance with the bae systems operational framework; managing the projects / delivery streams to ensure that they are compliant with all applicable uk & ksa legislative safety environmental requirements for the safety of wome products by undertaking reviews and regular process audits; providing independent wome assurance at project / delivery stream safety review meetings (sag, hmm & psec); undertaking reviews of wome processes and producing a duty of care risk assessment; undertaking regular visit to customer locations and reviewing / checking the wome storage and processing facilities managed by air ksa (flight line explosive storage areas, ejection seat arming / disarming, canopy storage areas, etc), excludes areas managed by the customer such as the munitions storage areas; assisting the head of wome to manage the wome community of practice to ensure a level of sqep is maintained; providing support to the head of wome to ensure the requisite wome engineering expertise and capability required to deliver wome manpower (eewe) is managed and sustained, including recruitment; providing independent safety & environmental advice and assurance to the delivery streams on the means of compliance to the safety aspects of the customer’s wome specific terms and conditions and product requirements; ensuring that the necessary wome training (modules a to d) is delivered in accordance with the wome mandate document, across the business unit (and kpcs) to provide knowledge of wome safety and procurement requirements; providing wome safety and environmental support to the engineering functional audits and ensure that any ncrs or observations raised are recorded and managed in accordance with the agreed timescales and provide a progress report to the head of wome on a monthly basis; be the main point of contact for organising and coordinating wome management procedures, by supporting the head of wome in managing the continuous improvements in the processes, procedures and toolsets, to share and adopt best practice across the domain; recruitment specification the post holder must: the candidate will have a degree in an engineering related discipline ideally with extensive proven practical experience and extensive experience in a management position; have extensive proven experience in a military wome engineering / support environment, ideally within the air force or naval domains; member of the institute of explosive engineers, or working towards; must be able to obtain membership of the saudi council of engineers (sce). ideally is a chartered engineer in a professional engineering institute or working towards gaining accreditation; hold an ielts level 8 certificate as a minimum if applicable; be able to review any new / emerging legislation and / or regulations and understand and brief the impact on current business unit processes with respect to governance, safety and environmental issues; have the ability to work to demanding deadlines, ensuring a high degree of accuracy, paying due regard to attention to detail, key performance indicators, and customer perception and feedback; have experience in mentoring, training and developing saudi national employees in the wome community (tagged eewe) across the core disciplines of wome topics including, procurement, explosive safety, handling storage and governance in order to increase the knowledge across the business unit, kpcs and bae systems ksa companies. have knowledge of engineering management and its application within a customer-facing environment; have experience in the application of requirements management, handover and acceptance; a working knowledge and experience in the application of engineering management within a weapons engineering technical domain would be advantageous; a working knowledge of product safety & environment (ps&e) policy and process as applied to the delivery of acceptably safe systems; have experience in leading wome safety investigations, drafting reports and presentations on issues for review and discussion at formal meetings (including with the customer); ideally have a working knowledge of engineering life-cycle management (elcm); ideally have knowledge and experience in understanding and resolving complex wome technical issues; ideally have a knowledge and understanding of bae systems saudi arabia (baessa) processes and procedures; be knowledgeable of export control requirements and may be required to handle export controlled/itar data. the post holder is required to interface directly with project leads from the baessa functional, projects, kpcs (kingdom partner companies), bae systems air and other service providers as detailed in the solution design; therefore, the following skills are required: stakeholder management competencies; leadership experience with ability to manage multi-disciplinary staff. recruitment recruitment can be either organic from within the company, in which case in addition to recruitment specification, the post holder will need to bring a thorough appreciation of the business relationship of bae systems strategy and operations within saudi arabia into the role. external candidates will also be considered. they will be required to come from a similar function within a commercially sensitive organisation that places considerable emphasis on ethical behaviour. they will be expected to contribute, in addition to the recruitment specification, a wide variety of wome experience that will complement, while enhancing, the existing functional operation. expatriate employee benefits in return for the required high levels of commitment and hard work you will receive a competitive salary, rent free accommodation and access to free recreation facilities, all available within company secured accommodation. in addition, a generous leave and travel allowance makes this an opportunity not to be missed. on successfully securing a role your appointment to saudi arabia will initially be on single status. on commencement of employment in saudi arabia you will have the opportunity to apply to have your family join you in the future. a full health care scheme is provided within saudi arabia. saudi national employee benefits in return for the required high levels of commitment and hard work you will receive a competitive salary and benefits package, including a generous leave and travel allowance, a full health care scheme and access to subsidised recreational facilities bae systems at bae systems, we provide some of the world’s most advanced, technology-led defence, aerospace and security solutions. we employ a skilled workforce of 89,600 people in more than 40 countries. working with customers and local partners, we develop, engineer, manufacture, and support products and systems to deliver military capability, protect national security and people, and keep critical information and infrastructure secure. all appointments in saudi arabia are subject to receipt of all necessary government and/or customer approvals.

responsibilities accountable for the management of heavy maintenance functions onsite at the assigned amo, required to ensure all schedule/unscheduled maintenance activities are coordinated and managed with the onsite mro team and saudia. work with the assigned mro’s, planning, engineering and supply chain to ensure all production control activities are managed effectively. participate in daily onsite production status meetings and update schedules. hold a commanding presence at the assigned amo’s to not only monitor but drive mro activities with the overall goal of improving tat, without impact to quality or standards. follow-up and escalate in case of dispute, work to improve project milestone activities and deadlines. review and accept, or escalate in case of dispute, work performed on aircraft in reference to saudia procedures and standards. lead, guide and direct the materials coordinator and assigned planner. ensure that all maintenance tasks, including inspections and repairs, are thoroughly documented, and recorded in the maintenance information system (mis). act as the primary point of contact between saudia and amo facility, facilitating communication and addressing any concerns or queries. inspect and approve completed maintenance tasks and documentation to ensure they meet sv quality and safety standards. ensure that necessary resources, parts, and support are available and properly utilized by the amo during the maintenance visit. identify and report any discrepancies or issues to the amo and work collaboratively to resolve them promptly. provide the amo project management lead (pml) with input required for procedure and process improvements. review, challenge if deemed necessary and support changes implemented by the amo project management lead. in reference to the sv maintenance program, will suggest improvements and enhancements to the maintenance program to improve durability, reduce line maintenance burden, improve corrosion prevention and control. monitors labor loading on the aircraft to support tat and critical path adherence. recommends material allocations to support tat and critical path adherence. coordinate with remote structural engineer and amo regarding repairs and dent mapping. provides detailed aircraft daily status report to sv planning department, highlighting completed tasks, in-progress tasks and deviations and/or risks to the schedule. additional work requests (awr) review and approval of all associated work orders and invoices, challenges overbilling, provides financial approval of invoices against their projects. reviews and challenges contractual compliance and drives warranty management. communicate with all relevant stakeholders on the progress of each heavy maintenance check and aircraft serviceability, including limitations and delays affecting heavy maintenance. ensure tooling, equipment, rotatable, spares, consumables and approved facilities are available, serviceable and optimal for the intended maintenance scope and planned work in advance of aircraft arrival. ensure that all maintenance tasks are recorded accurately & signed for to maintain correct & up to date aircraft history /data. execute the aircraft maintenance activities efficiently and on-time, mitigate all heavy maintenance interruptions to prevent recurrence on future checks. responsible for recommending enhancement processes and procedures to effectively contribute to improve productivity and aircraft on time deliveries from heavy maintenance function. ensure that any corrective action resulting from quality monitoring audits are completed in a timely manner. manage and report incidents / accident occurrences as per company and regulatory procedures, assists to facilitate safety investigations and root cause analysis to prevent repeat occurrences in future. monitor the aircraft 30 days post check for in-service reliability issues caused from the check. perform safety walks at least once per day at the facility whilst work is in progress, report all findings to svt quality and the mro quality leadership as per gmm procedures. adhere to the company safety, health, and environmental policy. promotes safety culture through implementation of sms processes and formal risk assessments when implementing operationally significant changes. implements the human factors and human performance principles and awareness in the working environment. ensures a safe and secure working environment for saudia employees. promotes quality of work, safety and security awareness. provides the appropriate time, training, resources and encouragement to saudia employees to support their involvement in the on-going development of saudia’s safety management system and safety culture. coach, mentor and inspire staff within the heavy maintenance team to enhance their productivity engagement. leads by example in terms of self-discipline and accuracy in his/her duties and motivates team to follow respectfully. behaves in a manner to reflect a professional approach when representing saudia and dealing with both internal and external customers. performs regular meetings with staff in terms of performance review, training (lessons learnt), management and improvement issues. reviews and plans training for his/her direct reports, to enhance and upskill the team. undertaking such other duties as may be reasonably requested by the heavy maintenance manager. required qualifications: minimum qualification holds a valid aircraft maintenance license from gaca/gcaa/ faa/ icao type ii/easa license plus has or had previously held applicable aircraft type authorization. specialist knowledge of aviation legislation/regulations excellent communication skills project management skills proficiency in computer applications and maintenance information system (mis). minimum experience minimum 7 years of aircraft maintenance experience, 2 of which should have been in a supervisory role in base maintenance preferably with similar types to sv fleet (b777/a320/b787/a330). holds direct working experience with heavy maintenance mro’s, oem’s and regulatory authorities. holds experience pertaining to aircraft heavy maintenance requirements and working environment, experienced with processes and necessary workflows. experienced in leading and developing a team of maintenance professionals in a frequently changing environment with continuously changing work-load schedules. work locations saudi arabia primary location saudi arabia unposting date ongoing

name: Projects Pioneers Contracting Company
title: Senior Estimation Engineer
description: an estimation engineer with a civil engineering background, particularly in infrastructure projects, typically performs a variety of tasks that combine technical knowledge with cost management expertise. their job description can include the following key responsibilities and skills: key responsibilities: cost estimation & budgeting: develop accurate cost estimates for civil engineering projects, including roads, bridges, drainage systems, water supply, sewage, and other infrastructure projects. prepare detailed quantity take-offs from architectural and engineering drawings. provide cost breakdowns of materials, labor, equipment, and other direct and indirect project expenses. tender & proposal preparation: prepare and review tender documents and bids for new infrastructure projects. analyze and evaluate contractors' or subcontractors' bids, proposals, and pricing strategies. work closely with project managers, procurement teams, and contractors to ensure competitive bidding. feasibility studies & risk analysis: conduct feasibility studies to assess the cost-effectiveness and financial viability of infrastructure projects. identify potential risks and propose strategies to mitigate cost overruns and delays. project cost monitoring & control: track and monitor ongoing project costs to ensure they stay within budget. provide cost forecasts and prepare cash flow projections during various phases of the project. adjust estimates as necessary based on project changes or unforeseen conditions. collaboration with project teams: collaborate with design teams, architects, structural engineers, and project managers to ensure cost-effective solutions are integrated into the design phase. liaise with clients, contractors, and subcontractors to clarify project scope and requirements. data management & reporting: maintain up-to-date records of all cost-related project data, including change orders and variations. prepare periodic reports to management, outlining project cost status, budget variances, and other financial aspects. provide post-project cost reports and analysis to help improve future estimates. technical knowledge & compliance: ensure that all estimates comply with industry standards, codes, and local regulations. keep up with advancements in construction materials, techniques, and tools to incorporate into the estimating process. use estimation software tools such as autocad, primavera, or specialized estimation programs. required skills: technical expertise: strong understanding of civil engineering principles, particularly related to infrastructure projects. proficiency in reading and interpreting technical drawings, plans, and specifications. attention to detail: precision in calculating quantities and cost elements to ensure accurate estimates. analytical & problem-solving skills: ability to analyze complex construction data and develop effective cost-control strategies. software proficiency: familiarity with industry-standard cost estimation and project management software (ms excel, cost , bluebeam, primavera p6, autocad). communication & negotiation skills: strong communication skills to collaborate with stakeholders, including clients, engineers, and contractors. time management: ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines effectively. knowledge of construction materials & methods: stay updated with current market prices for construction materials and labor, and understand construction methodologies. legal & regulatory knowledge: awareness of local building codes, construction regulations, and safety standards relevant to civil infrastructure projects. qualifications: education: a degree in civil engineering or a related field is essential. experience: typically requires 8 to 10 years of experience in cost estimation, with significant exposure to infrastructure projects like roads, bridges, utilities, and large-scale civil works. certifications: pmp (project management professional), or other relevant certifications are advantageous. the role demands a mix of technical engineering knowledge and financial acumen, ensuring that infrastructure projects are not only well-designed but also financially feasible and controlled from start to finish. job type: full-time pay: ﷼15,000.00 - ﷼18,000.00 per month

name: Proofpoint

description: it's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing! we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business. corporate overview proofpoint is a leading cybersecurity company protecting organizations’ greatest assets and biggest risks: vulnerabilities in people. with an integrated suite of cloud-based solutions, proofpoint helps companies around the world stop targeted threats, safeguard their data, and make their users more resilient against cyber attacks. leading organizations of all sizes, including more than half of the fortune 1000, rely on proofpoint for people-centric security and compliance solutions mitigating their most critical risks across email, the cloud, social media, and the web. we are singularly devoted to helping our customers protect their greatest assets and biggest security risk: their people. that’s why we’re a leader in next-generation cybersecurity. corporate overview proofpoint is a leading world stop targeted threats, safeguard their data, and make their users more resilient against cyber-attacks. leading organizations of all sizes, including more than 50% of the fortune 1000, rely on proofpoint for people-centric security and compliance solutions mitigating their most critical risks across email, the cloud, social media, and the web. we are singularly devoted to helping our customers protect their greatest assets and biggest security risk: their people. that’s why we’re a leader in next-generation cybersecurity. the role we are seeking a proactive, creative, and tenacious enterprise account manager to drive new cyber security business across multiple vertical markets across saudi arabia. this role will demand interaction with large scale enterprises at the ‘c’ level, as well as with technical staff within the security and it organisation. you will manage a portfolio of approximately 20 named accounts, encompassing a mix of white-space and existing customers. selling the full proofpoint platform, while leveraging all internal resources and our ecosystem of partners to enable continued growth of your account portfolio. in this role you will be able to expand the proofpoint footprint, ensuring your customers are effectively protected from advanced threats and targeted attacks by our award winning technology. your day-to-day establish strong business relationships at the executive level within enterprise accounts above 2,500 users (cross-vertical focus) focus on both penetrating new accounts as well as expanding our presence with existing customers by introducing them to all our security, compliance and information protection platform. articulate and promote the company’s value proposition and services to become a trusted advisor within your customer base work with internal resources, including aligned system engineers to prepare account strategies and plans. collaborate with systems engineers to organise and deliver compelling and flawless product demonstrations partner with the channel ecosystem to gain access into new accounts deliver operational excellence, to include forecast accuracy and pipeline generation progression maintain up-to-date knowledge of proofpoint’s competitive positioning in the marketplace what you bring to the team experienced technology sales professional, with a particular focus on saas value-based technologies. experience within cyber security is an advantage. proven track record of over-achieving targets, net new logo achievements and capacity to leverage channel partnerships within saudi arabia. relentless attention to detail and never-give-up attitude with a high level of activity, i.e., customer and partner meetings emphasizing executive value selling (ciso, cio, cmo, etc.) ability to establish business relationships at the executive level, and ability to become a trusted client advisor experience of closing complex opportunities in the range of $100k – $1m proficient user of formal sales playbook methodologies e.g. meddic, challenger, tas, command of the message. growth mindset, willingness to be coached, and diligence to follow a proven sales process entrepreneurial self-starter with a consistent focus on account planning, pipeline generation and opportunity progression. you’re strategic in approach, but always act with urgency. preferably you’ll have experience of using salesforce fluency in arabic and english is required why proofpoint supportive leadership; an inclusive and employee centric culture award winning and market leading technology we invest in our sales teams, through world-class leadership & enablement programs why proofpoint protecting people is at the heart of our award-winning cybersecurity solutions, and the people who work here are the key to our success. we’re a customer-focused and driven-to-win organisation with leading-edge products. we are an inclusive, diverse, multinational company that believes in culture fit, but more importantly ‘culture-add’, and we strongly encourage people from all walks of life to apply. we believe in hiring the best and the brightest to help cultivate our culture of collaboration and appreciation. apply today and explore your future at proofpoint! #lifeatproofpoint if you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us! if you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

name: Medtronic
title: Senior Principal Supply Chain Consultant CEMA
description: at medtronic you can begin a life-long career of exploration and innovation, while helping champion healthcare access and equity for all. you’ll lead with purpose, breaking down barriers to innovation in a more connected, compassionate world. a day in the life this exciting new role has been created to support, analyze, and optimize supply chain processes to improve efficiency and reduce costs to our clients, of which the primary one in the cema region is the saudi ministry of health. it will be a long-term consulting engagement, and you will be required to provide strategic guidance and deliver transformational supply chain projects, bringing your deep understanding of healthcare supply chain management principles to regulators, device and pharma suppliers and healthcare providers. this is a hybrid role supporting saudi arabia and other countries in the middle east region's business and customers. the role will report directly to the ihs (integrated health solution) emea supply chain director. travel is anticipated to be 75%. responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned: strategic planning and execution: develop and implement supply chain strategies that align with our client’s overall business goals. for example, this will include working on client’s procurement improvement initiatives, demand planning and stock management strategies. team leadership and development: lead and mentor a team of ihs people working with you on your assignments. this involves shaping and reviewing deliverables, providing training, and fostering a collaborative work environment. inventory management: review with our client the methods and kpis used to manage and optimise inventory and stock availability. this includes reviewing the quality of kpis to allow our client to have control over supply risks and performance of its network partners (such as gpos and 3pls). process optimization: evaluate and improve our client’s supply chain processes to improve service levels and controls in their role as healthcare provide (for example, ministry of health as regulator to providers in saudi arabia). implement best practices and leverage technology to streamline operations. performance monitoring and reporting: track key performance indicators of the ihs programme in conjunction with ihs pmo to measure the effectiveness of the programme. prepare and present regular reports to senior management. grow the ihs business: support ihs business development with new business opportunities for ihs to further grow in your region. required knowledge and experience: 12+ years experience in a healthcare supply chain environment, or similar strong consulting (at big 4 or boutique consultancy) and project management experience strong data management, analytical skills, presentation and communication skills supply chain / logistics / material management background essential hospital or medical device background is preferred good academic record, with mba or master’s degree in science, operations or supply chain management from tier-1 university is preferred fluent in english and arabic (written and spoken) is essential #li-linkedin physical job requirements the above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this position, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the required responsibilities and skills of this position. benefits & compensation medtronic offers a competitive salary and flexible benefits package a commitment to our employees lives at the core of our values. we recognize their contributions. they share in the success they help to create. we offer a wide range of benefits, resources, and competitive compensation plans designed to support you at every career and life stage. this position is eligible for a short-term incentive called the medtronic incentive plan (mip). about medtronic we lead global healthcare technology and boldly attack the most challenging health problems facing humanity by searching out and finding solutions. our mission — to alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life — unites a global team of 90,000+ passionate people. we are engineers at heart— putting ambitious ideas to work to generate real solutions for real people. from the r&d lab, to the factory floor, to the conference room, every one of us experiments, creates, builds, improves and solves. we have the talent, diverse perspectives, and guts to engineer the extraordinary.

name: AECOM
title: Electrical Engineer
description: company description work with us. change the world. at aecom, we're delivering a better world. whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. we are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations. there has never been a better time to be at aecom. with accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. we invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of over 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world. we're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. join us. job description builds analytic and design skills. conducts engineering design under the supervision of an experienced engineer. creates designs, calculations, sketches, diagrams, schematic drawings, and final working drawings under the supervision of an experienced engineer. collects and analyzes data under the supervision of an experienced engineer. uses computer software as a tool for solving basic engineering problems. performs work in accordance with agreed upon budget and schedule under supervision. additional information about aecom aecom is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. on projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. aecom is a fortune 500 firm and its professional services business had revenue of $14.4 billion in fiscal year 2023. see how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @aecom. freedom to grow in a world of opportunity you will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. whether you’re working from an aecom office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. you will help us foster a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. aecom provides a wide array of compensation, benefits and well-being programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. we’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too. join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. as an equal opportunity employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. all your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines.

name: Koch Engineered Solutions
title: Systems Process Engineer
description: your job koch engineered solutions is seeking a process engineer for our systems process team. the process engineer is responsible for the detailed process design of our systems solutions such as flare gas recovery systems and supports the commercial, order execution and aftermarket service teams for our systems product lines. we serve the international refining petrochemical, midstream, downstream and pharmaceutical markets. our team the systems process engineering team, a key part of koch engineered solutions combustion business focuses on flare gas recovery, thermal oxidisers, flares and vapour products and is part of the integrated business team for koch engineered solutions combustion business. the process engineer will collaborate with the local team but engage in continuous knowledge exchange with our global process team to find best solutions for our clients. all adhering to pbm principles. what you will do provide detailed process design of flare gas recovery systems. support all our systems products with the detailed process design. collaborate with the commercial, execution and customer aftermarket service teams. develop process design will include all components of a flare gas recovery system. oversee the process technology of our flare gas recovery and other system product solutions to support our clients over the complete lifetime of our installed equipment. prepare process documents, such as material and energy balance where required, equipment datasheets and p&ids for the project. participate in the project technical risk assessment, as well as system commissioning, troubleshooting and operators training at the customer site. apply pbm principles to drive continuous improvement and superior value creation for our clients. who you are (basic qualifications) demonstrated experience in product design specific to customer projects or equivalent work experience chemical engineering education background excellent communication skills strong adherence to compliance and pbm values available to travel 25%. what will put you ahead process design experience with flare gas recovery systems. process design experience with vapour combustion equipment. process design experience with thermal oxidation systems. experience working with combustion equipment process design experience with burners for process heaters or industrial boiler packages. experience with working directly with local and international customers and suppliers. at koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. this means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. the actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. if you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy. who we are as a koch company, koch engineered solutions specializes in process and pollution control equipment and digital technologies to help industries reduce emissions, save energy and get the most from their resources. from pollution control to advanced filtration, we're focused on providing customers with products and solutions to help them optimize, transform and succeed. industries we serve include refineries, chemicals, municipalities, pharmaceutical, pulp and paper, food and dairy, utilities and automotive. the equipment, technology and services group of kes serves customers with innovative, engineered-to-order solutions, supplying equipment for applications in various markets with a focus on the refining and petrochemical industry. john zink specializes in combustion technologies that include burners, flares, thermal oxidizers, boiler burners and vapor recovery systems . at koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company. additionally, everyone has individual work and personal needs. we seek to enable the best work environment that helps you and the business work together to produce superior results. #li-mb5
